loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 38 years old, married and has 3 children.  2 of her children are in school.

Connie is in an agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Connie requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Connie has been farming vegetables and rice for 17 years now and has borrowed 8 loans in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adecel

texts.en:
Adecel is married with four children. She is 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Adecel is a farmer and grows different kinds of vegetables in her vacant backyard to earn an income. It has been a hobby of Adecel's to plant in a small plot in her backyard for daily consumption. But her hobby has turned into a business. Adecel is enjoying the process of watching something grow, harvesting the product and earning income from selling vegetables. She has been doing this for more than two years with a monthly income of PHP 4,000.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and planting materials for vegetables

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Lilia has a tailoring shop that provides repairs and sews clothes like school and office uniforms. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed like cloth, a pair of scissors and needles.
Lilia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like cloth, a pair of scissors and needles

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 36 years old. She has six children who are aged from four to 15, some of whom she has adopted. Five are at school while the youngest is not yet at school. Pascasie sells foodstuff  which she has been doing for the past three years. This business has enabled her to take care of her family. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuff. With the profits she plans to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is 42 years old and widowed with three children.

Nema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like diapers, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Nema has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nema aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like diapers, groceries, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Sucheat

texts.en:
Sucheat, 32 years old, has been a hair cutter since 1993, and he always gets admiration from his customers about his work. His wife stays home to take care of their child, so every expense in the family is dependent on his career. He can make $6 per day for his income. He has one child, and he is 2 years old. 

Every month, he has to spend $60 on food, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He plans to repair his hair cut shop by decorating it to be more attractive and he will keep part of the profit from his career so that his child can get a good education in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Makoni Vegetable Vendors Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Beauty from Chitungwiza, a high-density suburb about 30 km from Harare. She is married with three children ages 4, 12 and 19 years old. Two of them attend school.

Beauty runs a vegetable stall at a market selling tomatoes, cabbages, onions and potatoes. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of capital.

Beauty has requested a loan of $400 to purchase fresh vegetables from a farm instead of the middleman. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her monthly income and improve her standard of life. In the future, Beauty plans to be a wholesaler at Makoni.

loans.use: to purchase produce from a farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 55 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income as a used clothing dealer and vegetable vender.

Grace is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide for a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 27 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Margarita works as a fisher-woman and catches fish to sell. She has been doing this work for 20 years with a monthly income of PHP 20,000 but still the income from fishing is insufficient for their daily consumption and for the education of their children. According to Margarita, she wants to have an additional fishing boat. So Margarita has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a brand-new fishing boat.

Margarita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Margarita hopes that she can buy a brand-new fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie is 31 years old. She has two children who are aged five and six. Her husband sells foodstuff while Leonie owns a restaurant in which she serves African dishes. She has run a restaurant for the past six years and it’s going well. This business has enabled her to feed her family and make some savings. Leonie is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuff for her restaurant and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits and later on build her own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from fish and vegetable vending.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like pants, t-shirt, sandals, etc.

Leonora has been supplementing her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who has sold fruit for the past eight years. She also earns income from buying and selling used clothing.

Ma. Rita has been supplementing her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Ma. Rita dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Miralona

texts.en: Miralona is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Miralona runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her sari-sari store. Miralona has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from raising hogs and selling feed and rice. Miralona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 48 years old and married with three children. For the past two years she has been raising livestock as well as growing sugarcane in the Philippines.

Romana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been active in mixed farming for over ten years, producing and selling coffee, milk and bananas to the local market. He is married and has one child, aged nine years. He gets additional income from his masonry work.

Kenneth has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES to start construction of a modern dairy unit. He hopes the better shelter will secure his cows, limit the common animal diseases and improve his income, which will enable him to educate his child.

He notes that animal diseases and the high cost of dairy feeds are still the greatest challenges for his farming business.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to purchase additional goods.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sarah Jane works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish.

Sarah Jane has been sustaining her business through her past sixteen loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to renew her registration and license for her motorcycle.

Sarah Jane hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To renew her motorcycle's registration and license.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is married with three children. He is 36 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He sells ice cream, carried by his motorcycle. Mobile ice cream is an excellent choice as a business enterprise. Rolly can transport the product in the local areas like public malls, beaches, schools and streets. He earns for his living about $135 per month. He's been doing this kind of business for five years. 

He wanted to have an additional container of ice cream to carry on his motorcycle, but he had no capital to purchase it, so he went to GDMPC and requested a loan of 7,000 PHP. Rolly has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In  the future, he hopes that he can have additional mobile ice cream in the town.

loans.use: to purchase an additional ice cream container.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is 34 years old and married with five children. She has been running a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines for the past two years as well as selling fish.

Vangie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

Vangie works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like milk, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in active farming for three years in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. His farm produces fruits, mainly bananas and passion fruit and milk. He is aged 26 and single. 

Stephen has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his fruit farming business, especially his bananas and passion fruit acreage. He hopes increasing the acreage under fruits through cultivation will increase his income and make him financially stable enough to start a family. He also intends to venture into a transport business in the future.

Stephen notes that an insufficient supply of water and diseases are the main farming challenges.

loans.use: to pay for expansion of his fruit farm acreage

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married.  She has five children, one of whom is in school.  Letecia works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store.

Letecia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft-drinks, soap, noodles and other groceries.   In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to enable her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married, with 2 children.  Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, groceries, etc,. in her sari-sari store.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and ready-to-wear clothes.  Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Sit

texts.en:
Mrs. Sit is a 27 years old.  Her husband is a high school teacher in his community, the Ornlong Veng district.  They have been married for a few years but do not yet have any children.  

Mrs. Sit is a good make-up artist for people who need her to make them up for their wedding day.  She also sells some cosmetic items in her house for additional income. Since 2009, she has had this business and is earning an average of $2 each day.  Recently Mrs. Sit’s business has been running better and better and she wants to buy more cosmetic products to sell.  However, she doesn’t have sufficient money to make such a purchase. This is the reason why Mrs. Sit is seeking a Kiva loan through HKL.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothing business in the Philippines.  Lucina has been in this business for 30 years.

She is borrowing PHP30,000 through NWTF to purchase bundles of used clothes to sell for her business.

Lucina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and married, with 3 children.  Zosima works very hard to provide for them.   She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.  Zosima has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Zosima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store and food vending.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for motorcycle maintenance.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for motorcycle maintenance

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roslie

texts.en:
This is Roslie, 40 years old, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a supervisor in a company, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for the future of her children.

Roslie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Roslie earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of about $11 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and firewood to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Roslie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a Palestinian woman from Rafah City in Gaza Strip. She is married and the mother of one daughter and three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. The family can't afford to purchase all the items they need for their house, so they do it every time they have the chance and money. Suhad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a computer for her children and a cooker as the one she has is very basic and becoming very old.

Suhad's husband appears in the photo as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a cooker.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 33 years now.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a generator for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 42 years old. Two of her children are in school.

Corazon has a general store business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, candies, etc. to sell in her store.

Corazon has been in this business for five years. In the future, Corazon would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, candies, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 42 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, lotion, perfumes and other Avon products to sell.

Ma. Delia has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling personal products business for 15 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Ma. Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, lotion, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.en:
Jennyfer is married with one child. She is 18 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she sells snacks in public areas, outdoor conventions and events, and beaches. She earns about $115 per month by doing this type of work. However, the income of being a hawker is not enough to sustain her family's daily consumption. 

She wanted to have additional capital to make many foods that she can sell everyday, that can multiply her income. Jennyfer went to GDMPC and she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for preparing food for sale.

Jennyfer has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future she hopes that she can build a refreshment building.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Femer

texts.en: Femer is 52 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. She has been into the hog-raising business for almost three years. Her net income is about $150 every two months. She's asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase hog feeds and vitamins. She wanted to increase her income to provide the needs of her children. She would also like to continue receiving loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 42-years-old mother of two daughters and three sons. Her oldest son graduated and wanted to have his own job, so she helped using her savings to rent a store and prepare it to become a grocery store. 

Fayza's son (who appears in the picture here instead of his conservative mother) needs to purchase more goods and to use the other half of the store, so his mother took out a loan from FATEN to purchase and install shelves in the store. 

Fayza's husband has retired therefore the store is the only source of income for the seven members family.

loans.use: to purchase and install shelves and prepare the entire space of the store to show grocery items

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie, 53 years old,  is married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annie has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 22 years. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phuk

texts.en: Mr. Phuk, age 38, works as a domestic construction worker in and around his community in Siem Reap province. He earns around $3 each day for the family's financial expenses. His wife is a fish seller in the local market and she also does chores at home. The couple has four children, most of whom are young and living under their parents' care and income. Mr. Phuk’s wife is a careful woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result, she attracts more clients who come to buy her fresh fish to eat. Therefore, Mr. Phuk is applying for a loan to support his wife's business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.use: to assist his wife's business by purchasing more fish to sell

loans.name: Odessa

texts.en:
Odessa is married but she has never been blessed with offspring. She is 49 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she has a mini grocery store at home. There, according to her, she creates friendships with everybody. The mini grocery also helps her to buy their daily needs. 

She earns approximately $202 per month, but Odessa wants to have more capital so that she can multiply her sales. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to sell. 
    
Odessa has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she wants to have a large grocery store with an available area for refreshment.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma.riza

texts.en:
This is Ma. Riza, 28, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She lives with her partner, Arnold, a carpenter, and is a mother to their child. She, together with her partner, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Riza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Ma. Riza earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of about $10 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Riza hopes that her business will turn into a grocery someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 60 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with four children, has been raising hogs for almost 30 years. She also sells vegetables and fish in their village as her other source of income, earning approximately 4000 PHP monthly in her businesses.

Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more hogs to raise. She would like to continue availing loans and hopes Kiva lenders will grant her loan and extend their support to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old engaged man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He has been doing construction work for almost five years. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works in local projects at the request of clients. 

He has benefitted from a first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for his newest project. In the future, he is planning to improve his work and expand his business operation by taking bigger projects and start working with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood

loans.name: Masrur

texts.ru: Масрур проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женат. Ему 36 лет. Он имеет одного ребенка. У него высшее образование, он инженер. На сегодняшний день Масрур предоставляет услугу такси. В этой области он работает три года. Кредит берет для капитального ремонта автомашины, то есть кузова, салона и ходовой части.
texts.en: Masrur lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 36 years old, married and has one child.  He has a higher education and is an engineer.  Currently, Masrur provides a taxi service and has been working in this field for three years.  He is requesting this loan in order to make major repairs for his car, i.e. trunk, interior and vehicle chassis.

loans.use: to make major automotive repairs

loans.name: 6 Tân Nam  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hạnh, the group leader of the 2.12.1.6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, comprised of six members, is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Hạnh has been operating a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for one year. Since her main business hardship is a lack of capital, she is requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase more vegetables for her business.

In the future, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, ensure her business success, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth, 49 years old, was an apprentice for five years and now he is a master craftsman. His wife is a farmer, and their income is $52 per day. They do not have any children. 

Their expenses are $80 for food, $5 for electricity and $10 for transportation.  

He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy zinc to roof his house because he wants to have a proper home to live in. His plan is to repair his house to be better than now when he has more profit.

loans.use: to buy zinc to roof his house.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 55 years of age, married to a farmer and blessed with 2 children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost 5 years. Her net income for three months is 3,000 PHP per hog. She's asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase hog feed and vitamins. With these loans and her patience and hard work, she hopes to achieve all her dreams for her children.

loans.use: Buy hog feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new fridge so he can serve his customers cold drinks.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda and her husband are Palestinian National Authority employees. They have two daughters and two sons (Aya, Farah, Muhammad and Ahmed). 

Ahmed, the eight-year-old son, is having breathing problems and needs urgent help, Raghda and her husband--who appears in the picture as she is a conservative woman--couldn't cover the expenses of their son's treatment so Raghda took out a loan from FATEN to pay for them.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical treatment

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 41 years old and married, with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Janet has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 28-year-old housewife and mother of one son. Her husband is a taxi driver; he started this profession six years ago and from the start has been saving a small amount of his income to be able to buy a car. 

Siham's husband (who appears in the picture next to the taxi) saved up a good portion of the car's price, but needed the addition of the $2,000 that Siham took out from FATEN to purchase it. They need the car's income for the family as sharing it with the agency was not feasible. 

Siham is a conservative woman therefore she refused to be photographed.

loans.use: to buy a taxi

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is a 39 years old married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops for sale.  Beverly does her best to support her family.  She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs and hopes that these items will help improve their harvest. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and five young children who are still attending school. 

She has owned a toy shop since 2007. She sells wide range of toys such as dolls, model cars, etc. Her products are designed for both genders. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store's inventory of new toys. In the future, she hopes to further expand her merchandise selection to be able to better satisfy her customer's demands.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of new toys collection

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 19-year-old housewife and mother of Ahmad, who is one year old. Her husband is a taxi driver; he started this profession three years ago,  transporting passengers between the south and north areas of Rafah in Gaza Strip. 

Haneen's husband (who appears in the picture) saved up a good amount of the car's purchase price and needed the $1,500 that Haneen borrowed from FATEN to buy the car. Owning the car will bring in a better income to support the family.

Haneen is a religious woman therefore she refused to be photographed.

loans.use: to buy the taxi her husband drives passengers with

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 34 years old, married,and blessed with 3 children. He's has been in the retail business for almost 3 years. He also has a motorcycle transport business as an additional source of income. His net income is 2,500 PHP a month. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, to purchase additional grocery items to sell in their village.  Support from Kiva lenders would be invaluable to him because he sees the loans as the only opportunity to grow his business and achieve financial security.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery items to sell in their village

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, 56 years old, has been a scavenger since 2001. His wife is a farmer. They both can get $7 per day for their income. He has one daughter, 25 years old, who stays in Phnom Penh. 

Every month, he has to spend $33 on food, $3 on electricity, and $5 for other expenses. 

Before he had only a cart, so he walked to buy the recycled things from the villagers. He couldn't go to buy things in the other village because it is too far, so he bought a bicycle to make his career easier. But now he prefers a motorbike because his career is getting better. He can make a good profit if he has a motorbike to transport those recycle things to sell.

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike that can help his career. Besides extending this career, he also wants to buy more agriculture land to plant crops such as corn and potato with his wife.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to expand the range of his recycling career.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: order more cartridges and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah, 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children, has been running a hotel (also known as a restaurant) for four years. She also supplies eggs and other types of food. 

This will be Juliah’s first loan with SEMP, with which she plans to renovate and expand her business premise. In the future, Juliah would like to own a big supermarket and hotel. Describing herself as hardworking and persistent, she hopes to live a happy and comfortable life with few challenges.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her business premise.

loans.name: Jescar

texts.en:
Jescar, age 50, has a business selling soaps and detergents to the residents in her local area. She describes herself as an honest and aggressive businesswoman. She and her husband have four children ranging from 12 to 30 years old. Jescar plans to use the loan to purchase raw materials to make soap. 

This is Jescar’s first loan with SMEP. She hopes to use the profits from her business to help her to purchase her own house. 

In the future, Jescar would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has been operating a healthcare center in a busy market for the last 12 years. Her primary business challenge is a shortage of electrical power. Ann plans to use the loan to buy more medicines for her patients at the heathcare center. She is a single mother with a daughter aged 13. 

This is Ann’s first loan with SMEP. In the future, Ann hopes to open a big hospital and several clinics in the surrounding area. 

Ann is highly dedicated to her work.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her patients at the heathcare center

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a 40-year-old woman from Tulkarem city in Palestine. Her youngest son had an accident when he was young and suffers from a disability in the lower part of his body. He is 12 years old now. 

Ansam took out a loan from FATEN to fix her son's wheelchair and install an electronic stick to help him control his movement independently. 

Ansam's husband can't afford to buy a new wheelchair or pay to repair the existing one as he works on a daily wage basis. 

Ansam appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to repair and upgrade a wheelchair her son

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, age 33, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails individual grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy such items as one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Leah earns her living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 240 in sales per day.

Leah lives with her partner, Randy, and their children in Caloocan City. Randy works as a school service driver, so Leah manages the household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leah hopes to be able to expand her shop soon, just as she hopes to improve on their standard of living and give her children an increasingly good future. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Leah faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 53, is a vendor of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and groundnuts. She has been offering her wares to the residents of a busy area for over nine years. Sarah plans to use the loan to buy more vegetables to offer for sale. She describes herself as highly dedicated to her work. She and her husband have seven children.
 
This is Sarah’s first loan with SMEP. In the future, she aspires to become a major supplier in the area. She hopes eventually to be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Sinorn

texts.en:
Sinorn, 31 years old, is a grocery seller and also has a small coffee shop at home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income per day is $8. They have two children, 7 years old and 1 month old. 

Every month, she has to spend $46 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $5 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy more things to sell in the grocery store. Before, she sold vegetables in the market, but the price of renting a store there was so expensive that she could not make profit from it, so she decided to stop and start selling groceries at home with her small savings. Now her career is better than before. She has more things to sell but still not enough for her customers, so she would like to buy some more for her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy things to sell in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Margaret Isabel, age 50, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails individual grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy such items as one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Margaret Isabel earns a living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 390 in sales every day.

She lives with her husband Oscar and their children in Caloocan City, Philippines. Together with her husband and children, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Isabel hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to be happy and successful. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Margaret Isabel faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, age 38, has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost four years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP in order to purchase additional commodities to sell. Her net income is 25,000 PHP a month. 

She is grateful for the continued assistance offered to her by Kiva lenders and intends to further improve her business. She will use the increased profits from her business to adequately support her family.

Regina and her husband, who operates a tricycle transportation business, have four children.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando, age 46, owns and operates a livestock business, particularly focusing on the raising of pigs. He has kept this business for almost 15 years. He is also a meat vendor in their public market. His net income is 10,000 PHP every three months. Orlando is a widower and the father of three children.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP in order to purchase additonal pigs to raise. He hopes to avail more loans in the future from Kiva field partner ASKI, and offers his thanks to the generous Kiva lenders who choose to assist him.

loans.use: to purchase additonal pigs to raise

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yaneth es una mujer de 50 años que vive con su conyuge y tiene tres hijos en las edades de 27 a 31 años, con los que sueña un futuro prometedor. Ella es bien conocida en su barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de Barranquilla por tener un negocio de miscelanea, donde tambien presta los servivios de internet y fotocopiado. Su historia en Barranquilla iniciò desde el año 1994 cuando llegò a esta ciudad procedente de su natal Sincelejo, ciudad ganadera y algodonera, buscando un mejor horizonte para sus hijos. Ella inició con un negocio de tienda que comprò con una herencia que recibió y gradualmente la amplió y agregò miscelanea y servicios de internet y fotocopiaje como en la actualidad està. Su conyuge y gran apoyo, tambien es trabajador independiente y se dedica a la venta de fritanguerìa, conoce muy bien el negocio de tienda porque tuvo experiencia en su natal Sincelejos en esta actividad cuando allì trabajó. Con sus negocios han logrado el sustento de su hogar y darle educaciòn a sus hijos, uno de ellos estudia ingenieria de sistemas en la universidad.  Yaneth ha recibido 8 financiamientos de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organizaciòn con la cual ha logrado, aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener dinero disponible para conseguir mejores precios en el mercado de proveedores, que la conocen y hacen tentadoras ofertas. Su meta mas adelante es realizar adeuaciones locativa para brindarle un total confort a sus clientes. Mientras sus sueños se cumplen ella sigue trabajando persistentemente, rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada tres dias, su inventario cada 23 y con una rentabilidad no menor a un 27%. Con su credikiva comprarà sandalias y calzado formal que le han ofrecido a buenos precios y con modelos llamativos por encontrarse muy a la moda; con ello sus mejores clientes, que ya le han encargado, se sentiràn muy satisfechos  y augura que su inversiòn tenga mucho èxito.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a woman 50 years of age who lives with her husband and has 3 children aged 27 to 31, with whom she dreams of a promising future. She is well known in her “7th of April” barrio in the city of Baranquilla for having a miscellanea store, where she also offers internet and photocopying services. 

Her history in Barranquilla began in 1994 when she arrived in this city proceeding from her native Sincelejo,  a cattle and cotton raising town, in search of a better future for her children. Yaneth began with a store which she bought with an inheritance she received, gradually expanding and adding miscellanea and internet and photocopying services, as at present.

Her husband and great help is also an independent worker, who has a fried food stall. Yaneth knows how to run a store because of her experience in this area in Sincelejo. With their businesses they have managed to sustain their home and offer education to their children, one of whom studies engineering at the university.

Yaneth has received 8 loans from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she has managed to augment her working capital and have money available  to obtain better prices in the provisions market, which she knows well and where she receives tempting offers.

Yaneth's future goal is to make improvements to her store and offer better comfort to her customers. While her dreams are being realized, she continues working persistently, passing through her collection accounts every 3 days, her inventory each 23 days, with a profit of no less than 27%. With her “credikiva” she will buy sandals and formal shoes based on the good prices offered, and of attractive  models that are in style. With this, her best customers, who have already placed orders, will be satisfied thus indicating that her investment should be very successful.

loans.use: buy sandals and formal shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GOLD est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé,afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Odile est née 18 janvier 1964 au Bénin et est mariée à Emile un agent du port autonome du Bénin. Le couple à trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Odile mène comme activité depuis trois ans la vente de divers produits (sucre, lait, savon etc.). Odile s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Odile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe Gold, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GOLD is a group composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for raising their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Odile, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Odile was born on January 19, 1964 in Benin and is married to Emile, an agent at the autonomous port of Benin. The couple has three children, who are all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are ensured by the couple. To do so, Odile has been running a business for three years selling a variety of goods (sugar, milk, soap, etc.). She is supplied from the biggest market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her revenues, Odile, along with the other members of the group GOLD, is requesting a third loan. The loans received in the past have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sugar, soap, and milk

loans.name: Gary Zaldy

texts.en:
Gary Zaldy, age 34, has a retail shop where he sells dry goods. He has been in this business for almost 10 years. He and his wife have no children as yet.
 
Gary is asking for a loan of 40,000.00 PHP to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dry goods to offer for sale in his store. Each month, he earns about 8,000.00 PHP from his business.

In the future, Gary hopes to improve his business and start up another kind of business in the future. He believes that he will be able to achieve his business goal someday through the continuous support and assistance of those generous Kiva lenders who choose to support him.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of dry goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land on which to plant seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sharofatjon

texts.en:
Sharofatjon is a hardworking woman. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Sharofatjon tries to improve her family's life and that’s why she works hard from early morning until late at night. Sharofatjon is engaged in the processing of dried fruit; she dries apricots and then sells them at a good price. Sharofatjon would like to get a loan of 8,000 TJS to purchase a garden of apricots in order to expand her business and increase her profits. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a garden of apricots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Mr Alassane est marié père de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Tous les 3 vont à l’école et il a 4 personnes à sa charge.

Mr est mécanicien de Caterpillar depuis 16 ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 de Ouagadougou, au Ghana et au Niger. Ses clients sont tous ceux qui possèdent des Caterpillar.

Il veut acheter des pièces de rechange (un carié de convertisseur et un pion de carié de convertisseur).

Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (mieux s’occuper de ses enfants et de son épouse).Il ambitionne ouvrir un garage pour caterpillar, une boutique de vente de pièces détachés et construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Alassane is married and a father of three. His oldest child is ten years old and his youngest five years old. All three go to school, and he supports four people.

He has been a Caterpillar mechanic for 16 years. He gets his supplies at Ouagadougou sector 10's market, in Ghana and in Niger. His customers are anyone owning a Caterpillar.

He wants to purchase spare parts (a crankcase and a crankshaft for a torque converter).

Mr. Alassane uses his profits to improve his family's living conditions (taking better care of his children and spouse). His ambition is to open a repair shop for Caterpillar, a spare parts retail store and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a crankcase and a crankshaft for a torque converter.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is married and has two children. Her husband is a machinist. Zarinna helps her husband to take care of their family. She sells everyday products in her grocery store, which is located near her house. She purchases the goods two times a week from Khujand City. Her monthly income is about 1,500 Tajikistan somonis (TJS). Zarrina would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS for purchasing a new assortment of foods in order to expand her business and allow customers greater choice. She carefully and responsibly applies for loans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of foods

loans.name: Benton

texts.en: Benton is a 27-year-old born-again Christian. He is single. To earn a living, he operates two retail shops. He has been operating the businesses for one and a half years. In addition, he runs a motorbike transport business to generate more income. Benton says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become financially stable and is currently operating two retail shops. In five years, he expects to have grown his business to another level. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to open a third retail shop.

loans.use: to open another retail shop

loans.name: Dananai Group

texts.en: Kudakwashe (in the middle of the photo) is 32 years of age and from the city of Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with two children aged 6 and 11, both attending school.  Kudakwashe runs a business selling clothes, shoes and some electrical goods. The business has been in operation for 4 years. Kudakwashe says the main challenge she faces are late payments from customers. She has requested a loan of $400 to boost her business by buying a selection of warm clothes for resale during the winter months. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have a better life. In the future, Kudakwashe plans to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy a selection of warm clothes

loans.name: Muattar

texts.en:
Muattar is an honest woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a dump-truck driver. Muattar engages dried fruit production. Her daughter helps her with this business. She tries to improve her living conditions and expand her business in order to make a good profit. That's why Muattar would like to get a loan of $1,500 USD for purchasing fresh apricots to process.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy apricots to process

loans.name: Nuruila's Group

texts.en:
Nuruila is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she has raised five children. The oldest daughter is married, and the other children are students. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 17,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS), Nuruila started to sell children’s clothing. At the moment her business is running well, and she earns 15,000 soms per month. Her daughters help her in running the business. With money received from the loan, Nuruila wants to purchase summer clothes in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future she wants to build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira, an honest woman whose husband works in Russia, is the mother of three children. Assisted by her son, Munira has been running her business selling foods including sweets, chocolate, juice, drinks, etc. for eight years. Working hard to take good care of the family, she is requesting a loan of 7,500 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to purchase a greater assortment of goods.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy an assortment of food for her store.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en: Linda (in the middle) is 32 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is single with one child, who attends school.  Linda runs a clothing business selling clothes and shoes as well as some electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for one year. She says overcoming the current slow pace of business is her main challenge. Linda has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and shoes. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy a residential stand. In the future, Linda plans to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Mr Abdoulaye est célibataire sans enfant et n’a personne en charge.

Il gère un TELECOM (vente d’accessoires de téléphone et réparation de téléphone), depuis 3 ans. Mr s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché du secteur 10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont tous ceux qui possèdent des téléphones portables (dans le quartier et ses amis).

Il veut acheter du matériel de réparation et accessoires (un demi paquet de façade, 20 écouteurs, 10 baffles, 10 fourreaux, 20 micros 7 batteries etc.).

Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Il ambitionne agrandir sa boutique de TELECOM et se marier.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a single man with no children or dependants. 

He  has run a TELECOM shop (selling telephone accessories and telephone repairs) for three years. He sources his goods from the large market and from the smaller district 10 market of Ouagadougou. His customers are all those who own mobile phones (all those in his quarter, as well as his friends). 

He would like to purchase telephone repair tools and phone accessories (half a pack of phone covers, 20 ear pieces, 10 speakers, 10 cases, 20 mouth-pieces, 7 batteries etc). He uses the profits generated from his business to improve his living conditions; his aim is to grow his TELECOM business and to get married.

loans.use: to purchase telephone repair tools and accessories

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Ильхом проживает в городе Душанбе. Холост. Ему 24 года. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его мама работает домкомом, а отец таксистом. Сам он имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии он проработал 2 года. Сейчас Илхом предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Так как на сегодняшний день цены на топлива увеличились, Илхом хочет установить оборудование для установки природного газа.  Поэтому он берет кредит в Хумо. Если клиент установит газовое оборудование, то в этом случае цены на такси снизятся и это даст населению передвигаться на такси по доступным ценам. И кроме того он сможет получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Ilhom lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents.  His mother works as a residential property manager, and his father works as a taxi driver.  Ilhom has a higher education in economics and spent two years working in that field.  Currently, Ilhom provides taxi services and has extensive experience in this field.  Due to current high fuel prices, Ilhom wants to convert his car to run on natural gas.  This is why is requesting a loan from Humo.  If Ilhom installs the gas equipment, he can lower his taxi prices, which would offer people a more affordable way to use taxi transportation.  Besides, he would be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: to install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom is a hardworking man. He is married and the responsible father of two sons. His wife is a housewife. Islom is engaged in the business of drying and selling of fruits. Islom wishes to improve his living conditions, so he hopes to expand his business and to make a good profit. Islom would like to get a loan of 8,000 TJS for purchasing of fresh apricots to process and sell them at a good price. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh apricots to process.

loans.name: Ashigbayar

texts.en: Ashigbayar is 25 years old and lives with his parents in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Umnugobi province of Mongolia. He manages a hair salon in his town, which he started in 2007,  with the help of his younger brother. He is a hardworking man who says, "I am planning to expand my business and to buy new equipment for it." He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase beauty products for his hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for his hair salon.

loans.name: Jehova Jaire Group

texts.en: Gladys (the lady with white stockings, fourth from the left) is 45 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with four children aged 22, 23, 24 and 28. Currently only one child is attending school.  Her husband is self-employed. Gladys runs a clothing business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge faced is failure to get payments on time. Gladys has requested a loan of $400 to boost her business stock by buying more clothes such as t-shirts, trousers and blankets, which is in high demand given that winter has arrived. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have more disposable income for the family. In the future, Gladys plans to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Womens Group

texts.en: 2 years is the amount of time 34 year old Mohammed has been operating his shoe sales business in Kayunga. The father of 5 says he began this enterprise with savings from his farming business. As for the future, he is hoping he can use his diligence to make substantial progress. He says this business can generate as much as 180,000 shillings in sales revenue each month. With this loan, Mohammed says he is going to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en: Selenge is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son is 4 years old and attends kindergarten. Selenge manages a business in his town making wooden products, which he started in 1995. In the summer he builds houses, and then focuses on making wooden products during the other seasons. In 2005 he bought new equipment for his business in order to make more quality products and also to start making iron products. Since then his business has been quite successful, which has allowed him to employ two more workers. Now he makes all kinds of household goods such as tables, chairs, beds, etc. He is a hardworking man who is doing his best to feed his family. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is 48 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son, who is 20 years old, goes to college. Purevsuren manages a meat trading business in a rented stall at a trading center called Zanabazar. He started his business in 2001 and is planning to expand it in the future. He collects meat and meat products from herders and sells them at his stall. He also operates a taxi service in order to supplement to his income. He is a hardworking man who says, "I want my son to be educated and to be a better person." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat for his business.

loans.name: Mehmon

texts.en:
Mehmon is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of three children. Mehmon is engaged in a farming business. He cultivates potatoes and wheat. Mehmon wants to improve his living conditions and to expand his business. Mehmon would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS for purchasing mineral fertilizer in order to get a good harvest and to make a good profit. With the profits he hopes to make, he plans to purchase cattle. This loan will be the first loan which he applies to Imon International. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her four children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two eldest children are construction workers, while the youngest one goes to college. With the help of her daughter, Oyun manages a traditional Mongolian clothing business in a rented stall at a trading center. She graduated college as a tailor in 1977 and worked at a public center until 1999, when she started her business. She is one of the most experienced tailors in her town. Now she has many regular customers and 1,200,000 MNT worth of working capital. She makes a variety of traditional Mongolian clothes for all ages. Her products are well-known amongst her customers for their quality and durability. She is a polite and hardworking lady who says, "One must possess a good character in order to have a pleasant life." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.  She is planning to renew her equipment soon.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and buy clothing for her sons

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 37 year old businessman. He is married to Sarah, who is also a businesswoman.  Peter has been operating a handcart repair service in a busy open-air market as his primary business for the past 6 years.  He also offers a handcart transportation service as his secondary business.  His monthly income is KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. His wife also contributes to the family income. 

Peter is applying for his first loan with KADET, after being introduced by an existing KADET member.  He will use the loan to purchase handcart repair materials, which will help him increase his income.  With the anticipated profit from the businesses he plans to improve his family’s standard of living. His dream is to own many handcarts for hire.

loans.use: to purchase handcart repair materials.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old, and has a 3-year-old child with her husband Andrew. For the past 3 years she has been operating a retail shop in Tala town. She gets a profit margin of KES 8,000 per month.

With her first loan from KADET LTD Janet plans to buy more washing detergent, cooking oil, maize flour, salt, sugar, soft drinks, and matchboxes to sell.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to start selling cereals and to pay her children’s school fees. In the future she hopes to grow her business and own a wholesale shop in Tala town.

loans.use: to buy more washing detergent, cooking oil, maize flour, salt, sugar, soft drinks, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cabbages and aubergines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old, and has two children with her husband David.  She has been operating a restaurant in Tala town where she sells various types of meals to her customers.  Her monthly income is KES 9,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and this is her second loan from the organization.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy cooking oil, baking flour, corn flour, firewood, charcoal, salt and sugar.  The anticipated profits will help her to educate her children, and, in the future, to grow her business and own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking flour, corn flour, firewood, charcoal, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.ru:
Гагик родился в 1961 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Неркин Анд (Nerkin Hand). Женат с 1998г и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 12 лет, младшему 10 лет, оба учатся в сельской школе. Жена работает бухгалтером.
С 1982 г Гагик занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота, пчеловодством и земледелием. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (мед, говядина, молоко, пшеница и т.д) он продает на рынке своим постоянным клиентам. 
Гагику необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения сена и для организации уборки урожая пшеницы.
texts.en: Gagik was born in 1961 in the city of Kapan and currently lives in the Nerkin Hand village.
