He has been married since 1998 and has two sons, the oldest of whom is 12 years old and the youngest is 10.  Both of them attend a village school.  Gagik's wife works as an accountant.  Since 1982, Gagik has been involved in breeding cattle, beekeeping and agriculture.  He sells his agricultural products (honey, beef, milk, wheat, etc.) at the market to his loyal customers.  Gagik needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram in order to buy hay and organize harvesting activities.

loans.use: to purchase hay and organize harvesting

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old. He and his wife Mary do not yet have children.  He has been in the motorcycle transportation business (locally known as “Boda boda”) for the last four years, and earns an income of KES 10,000 per month. He operates along the Tala-Kangudo road.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a group member, and is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy spare parts for his motorbike. He intends to use the anticipated profits to grow his business by saving to buy another bike.  In the future he plans to own a fleet of Matatu  (transport vans).

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is an enterprising 30 year old business lady who is married to Morris, who works as a driver. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past 3 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,500, which she uses to support her family.

Ann is applying for her first loan with KADET, after being introduced to the organization by staff. She will use the money to increase her stock of things like tomatoes, kale and potatoes.  With the anticipated profits from her business she plans to improve her family’s standard of living. Her dream is to own a big grocery store.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes, kale and potatoes.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married and has two teenage sons. She runs a small vending business selling household items, books, office supplies, souvenirs and gift sets in a local marketplace of Kamenka. Yevgeniya has been in this business for 11 years. Her family has been actively helping her run the venture. Presently, Yevgeniya has already about 80,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Yevgeniya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional supplies for seasonal trade. She is hoping to stock her merchandise on inflatable toys, air mattresses, balls, rubber rings, as well as a variety of greeting cards and puzzles. One of her main goals is to continue investing in her enterprise, seeing it grow and develop even more.

loans.use: to purchase inflatable toys and office supplies for summer season trade.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 35 year old taxi driver.  He and his wife Ann are blessed with two children who are in school. He has been in the taxi business for the past 2 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

James is applying for his third loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to service his taxi car, which has been used for a while without being checked to see how everything is operating. He intends to use the anticipated profits to pay his children’s school fees. His dream is to own many cars for hire.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two grown children. She lives in Melitopol and sells women’s clothing in the town’s central marketplace. She offers a nice selection of clothing items at reasonable prices. She is an enterprising and determined vendor with about 17 years of experience working in this trade. She has 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Valentina is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase women’s summer clothing. She is hoping to increase her sales and eventually improve her living conditions.  One of her short-term business plans is to open an additional vending location in the very near future.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter Njoroge is a 47 year old farmer, and he is married to a woman who is also a farmer. They have adult children.  He has been in mixed-crop farming for the past 10 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the money to purchase fertilizer and seedlings, which will be used on his farm during this planting season. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming activities. His future dream is to export his farm's produce to other areas.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is a private entrepreneur from Melitopol. He works with clothing merchandise, selling men’s clothing inventory in a local marketplace of his home town. Dmytryi’s kiosk is well known at the market for a variety of assorted clothing items and prices affordable for an average Ukrainian. Dmytryi has been in the trade for 7 years. Presently, his turnover capital amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. His income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Dmytryi is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise, i.e. tank tops, shirts and tees for men. He is hoping to generate additional income to be re-invested in further expansion of his business and to be used for personal needs. One of Dmytryi’s plans is to do remodeling in his apartment which is always a costly enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing merchandise for men.

loans.name: Magoma Nezikokolima Group

texts.en: 40 year old Buwembo has been in the construction business for 24 years now. Through these years, he says he has gone through the full mill of construction work and his confidence at succeeding in this type of business has always been sky high. In Mityana, like in many other areas in Uganda,the construction business is booming. This means people like Buwembo can get work on a regular basis. Buwembo is happily married with 6 kids and he says he began this business with the financial help of a close friend in Mityana town. Before that, he was engaged mostly in farming. He still finds time to do farming as it is a business from which he has been eking out side income. Per week, he says this business churns out 90,000 shillings as income. With this loan, Buwembo says he is going to purchase more land to do large scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase land to do more large scale farming.

loans.name: Ara

texts.ru:
Ара родился 1985г. в городе Капане, окончил Капанскую среднюю школу, после окончании которой поступил в проф.тех. училище.
В 2008г. он поступил на работу в Зангезурский Медно Молибденовый комбинат г. Каджарана, где работает токарем по сей день. 
Ара не женат и живет вместе с матерью и младшим братом. После работы вместе с братом Ара занимается разведением свиней и кур. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию они реализуют на Капанском городском рынке. 
Сумма кредита в $ 1,400 нужна для заготовки корма на зиму и для покупки цыплят, а также, для частичного ремонта автомобиля, который используется при перевозке сельскохозяйственных продуктов.
texts.en: Ara was born in 1985 in the city of Kapan.  After graduating from the Kapan secondary school, he attanded a professional technical college.  In 2008, he started working at the Zangezursk Copper Molybdenite factory in the city of Kadjaran, where he still works as a lathe operator now.  Ara is not married and lives together with his mother and a younger brother.  In addition to this work, Ara and his younger brother are involved in breeding pigs and chickens.  They sell their agricultural products at the Kapan city market.  Ara needs a loan in the sum of $1,400 for the preparation of animal feed for the winter and purchase of baby chickens, and also for partial repairs for his automobile, which is used to transport agricultural products.

loans.use: to prepare animal feed for the winter, buy baby chickens and to make automotive repairs.

loans.name: Biakida

texts.en:
Biakida is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 4 years, Biakida has operated a charcoal selling business, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. Biakida faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and selling by wholesale in the future. With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее двое взрослых детей. Оксана имеет собственный бизнесс —  продает качественную мужскую и женскую обувь на центральном рынке в своем родном городе. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода семьи.

У Оксаны  удачное расположение торговой точки с большой проходимостью людей. Впрочем,  это не единственный фактор успеха ее бизнесса. Оксана положительный и энергичный человек, она вежливо обходится с клиентами и всегда страется  помочь им сделать найлучший выбор. Оксане нравится ее работа и она имеет большой опыт в этом деле. 

Оксна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 12000 гривен на приобретение дополнительного сезонного товара. Оксана надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и использовать ее для расширения своего бизнеса. Ее цель -  открытие новых торговых точек.
texts.en: Oksana is married and has two grown children.  She has her own business and sells quality men and women shoes at the central market in her native city.  This business is the only source of income for her family.  Oksana has a favorable retail outlet location in a high traffic area.  This is not the only success factor of her business.  Oksana is a positive and energetic person.  She is polite with her customers and always tries to help them make the best selection.  She likes her work and has extensive experience in this business.  Oksana is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 hryvnia for the purchase of additional seasonal merchandise.  She hopes to increase her profits and use them for the expansion of her business.  Her goal is to open new retail outlets.

loans.use: to purchase additional seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is an enterprising 38 year old businessman. He is married to Grace, a business lady who contributes to the family income. He has been running a motorcycle transport business as his primary business, but he also runs a green grocer operation as a secondary enterprise. He has been able to manage the second business with the support of his wife for the past 3 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 4,000, which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for his sixth loan with KADET, after repaying his previous loans successfully. He will use the money to service his motorcycle. With the anticipated profit from his two businesses he will educate his children. He also hopes to buy a taxi car and invest more money for his family’s future use.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marcelo Vicente

texts.en:
Marcelo, age 37, works with metal in his workshop. He is completely dedicated to his work, very active, and has a lot of energy. He seeks this loan to buy raw material for his business. Marcelo and his wife live near the city of Otavalo, Ecuador, and have a nine-year-old daughter.
 
Marcelo's business is going very well thanks to a previous loan from FODEMI. Marcelo reports that his microenterprise is growing. He has been getting loans from FODEMI for a period of two years and has seen his economic condition improve. His goal is to see his microenterprise grow much larger. He wants to expand his workshop and provide a higher standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his metal workshop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 37, earns a living by running a salon. She has been in this business for ten years. She is a widow and has three children, all enrolled in school. She works hard in her business to provide for her family and to afford the education of her children.  
 
Mary has benefited from Faulu Kenya through their financial education program. This has helped her to run her business well. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy hair weave.

loans.use: to buy hair weave

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a businessman who operates a (bodaboda) motorbike transportation business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years.  Previously, Stephen was employed. He works hard in his business to educate and provide for his seven-year-old child. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management, which has helped him to plan his finances. He hopes to grow his business ten times in five years. He has requested for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a soft drinks selling business, selling by retail and from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers needs in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of soft drinks and mineral water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of soft drinks and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella teje chompas y pantalones para niños y niñas y lo vende en forma independiente, ella vende en una de las ferias de la ciudad de Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de chompas y pantalones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de colores para tejer las chompas y pantalones. 
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  She knits sweaters and pants for boys and girls and sells them independently.  She makes her sales in one of the street markets in the city of Cusco, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  Through her businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand and improve her business knitting sweaters and pants.  She is requesting a loan to buy colored yarn with which to knit sweaters and pants.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy colored yarn for knitting sweaters and pants

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Matagiri, who is in his mid 40s, is married. He has five children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of selling perfumes from door to door since 2000. He works from 8.30am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Matagiri's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to repair his house by repainting, put a month floor and better doors.  He also bought more perfumes to sell and during that time he started a catering business. So he bought utensils for the catering business. He has paid back all his loans successfully and wishes for a loan to buy more perfumes to sell.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Reebok", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, y en las noches la socia vende pizzas en el local de restaurant, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant y comprar sillas, ollas y productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y verduras.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 8.00am to 4.00pm and, in the evenings, she sells pizzas from her restaurant premises.  The borrower would like to expand and improve her restaurant business.  She is requesting this loan to equip her restaurant and buy chairs, pots and cooking supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip her restaurant and buy chairs, pots and cooking supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: La señora Luz tiene una amplificación y atiende todo tipo de eventos sociales. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de parlantes que le ayudaran mucho para de trabajo. Vive en alquiler con su hija, en una casa  ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, ella es madre soltera. Esta serála segunda vez que su préstamo se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Luz has amplification equipment and she provides a service at all kinds of social events.  She needs this loan to buy speakers which will help her a lot in her work.

Luz is a single mother and lives with her daughter.  She rents a house in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  This will be the second loan that Luz has received through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy speakers for her amplification service that she provides at social events

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy y su esposo tienen una renta de jubilación. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de matriculas universitarias de su hijo menor. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos pero sus  dos hijos mayores  ya son casados. Es clienta antigua de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y con buen historial de pagos.
texts.en: Nancy and her husband live off a retirement pension.  She seeks credit to cover the tuition payment for her youngest son to attend college.  She lives in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz, and her other two sons are married and live independently.  She has been a member of IMPRO since 2008 and has always met her payment obligations.

loans.use: to pay college tuition for her son

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: harina, leche, azúcar, fideos  y otros, para su venta en la tienda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Martha owns a grocery store.  She needs a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.  She lives in her own home, in Alto Irpavi district, in the city of La Paz.  Martha is married and has two children.  She has been a client of ours since 2008.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, noodles and other products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: La señora Placida se dedica a la elaboración de polleras (son faldas especiales para señoras campesinas). El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser telas de diversos colores y diseños, hilos, forros. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Villa Concepción de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene seis hijos. Su negocio funciona desde el año 2008 y su relación con IMPRO es desde la misma fecha.
texts.en: Placida makes 'polleras' (special skirts that are worn by rural women).  She needs the loan to buy raw materials such as different colors and designs of fabric, threads and linings.  She lives in rental accommodation in Villa Concepción district, in the city of La Paz.  Placida is married and has six children.  She has owned her business since 2008 and has been a client of IMPRO since that time.

loans.use: to buy colored fabric, threads, linings etc. for her business making 'polleras' (traditional skirts)

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene un vehiculo que trabaja en el sindicato Litoral, en el área de Trufis de servicio de pasajeros; también trabaja como chofer en una institución pública. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor y el arreglo de la caja del vehiculo de su propiedad, pues es la fuente principal de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa propia misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Bajo Seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Hugo has a vehicle with which he works as a member of the Litoral drivers' union.  He provides a passenger transport service.  He also works as a driver for a public institution.

Hugo needs this loan to buy an engine and to fix the gearbox on the vehicle which he owns.  This is the main source of income that he has to cover his expenses.  Hugo lives in his own home which is located in Bajo Seguencoma district, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy an engine and fix the gearbox on his vehicle which he uses to provide a passenger transport service

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 43, provides computer services such as photocopying, printing, and typesetting. As the single mother of a three-year-old, she works hard to educate her child. Prior to starting this business, Grace earned a living by farming.  

Grace has gained business management knowledge from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. She dreams of opening other business outlets in the future. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a computer, printer, cartridge, and envelopes.

loans.use: to buy a computer, printer, cartridge, and envelopes

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando Antonio vive junto a su compañera de vida. Tiene 2 hijos que asisten a un colegio público, ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para mantenerlos en un privado. Su actividad es bar y restaurante, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Lo inicio  con poco capital que tenia y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado crecer. Actualmente el se encuentra muy bien establecido ya que sus clientes llegan a solicitar del servicio que el proporciona. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, manteles, sillas, licor y verduras.
texts.en:
Fernando Antonio lives together with his life partner.  They have two children who attend a public (state) school since they don't have enough money to send them to a private school.

Fernando's business is a bar / restaurant which is located in his home.  He started out with a little capital that he had and, with the help of loans, he has managed to grow his business.  The business is currently very well established as his customers come to request the service that he provides.

Fernando will use the loan that he is requesting to buy basic grains, soda, juice, tablecloths, chairs, liquor and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, juice, tablecloths, chairs, liquor and vegetables

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela vende sándwiches, pero también tiene los ingresos de empleada domestica. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: todo tipo de carnes, pan, lechuga, tomate y condimentos para continuar con su negocio de venta de sandwiches. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Concepción de la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009 con un buen historial de pagos.
texts.en:
Graciela sells sandwiches and also makes income from working as a cleaner.  She needs this loan to buy supplies.  She will buy all kinds of meat, bread, lettuce, tomatoes and condiments, so that she can continue in her sandwich business.

Graciela lives in her parents' home which is located in Villa Concepción district, in the city of La Paz.  She is a single mother and has two children.  She has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and has a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, lettuce, tomatoes and condiments for her sandwich business

loans.name: Piscis De Agua Escondida Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Picis D. Agua Escondida, por que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Agua escondida en el Estado D. México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes. La señora Ana es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 22 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y se dedica a la cria y engorda D. ganado que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más puercos ya que en eL poblado se utiliza mucho a los puercos en las fiestas para comer y tambien para comercializar su carne por lo cual le hacen muchos pedidos y tiene que invertir para poder expandirse a comunidades aledañas. La señora los cria y alimenta desD. pequeños para poder venderlos a buen precio por la región. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere terminar la construccion D. su casa y ahorar para la educación D. sus hijos y así ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Picis D. Agua Escondida" because it is located in the community of Agua Escondida, in the State of Mexico.  The group has eight members and Ana is the group's president.

Ana is 22 years old.  She has a high school level of education and her business is raising and fattening livestock.  She started this business two years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy more pigs since pigs are commonly eaten in the village during fiestas.  She would also like to sell their meat because she has many orders.  She will invest in her business because she would like to expand it into neighboring communities.  Ana raises and feeds her pigs from the time they are very young so that she can sell them for a good price in her region.  She would like to use the profits she makes to finish building her house.  She would also like to save up for her children's education and be able to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco Antonio es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de madera para aumentar el capital de trabajo, pues ha recibido algunos contratos y necesita terminarlos.   Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito y el análisis de su flujo de fondos indica que está en posibilidades de pagar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco Antonio is a carpenter and has a small workshop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood so that he can increase his operating capital. He has already received a few contracts and needs to fulfill them. Marco lives at his parents’ house in the District of Alto Irpavi in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the first time Marco has requested a loan. The analysis of his cash flow indicates that he is capable of repaying this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and pay labor to help him plant rice on his farm

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Paula; tiene 52 años de edad; la socia tiene 6 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar; la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas caseras, la asocia elabora sus comidas típicas en casa y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate, la socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y de esta manera apoya en el hogar económicamente, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las comidas típicas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. de Tayancani”. She lives in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Paula is 52 years old and has six children. She divides her time between her household activities and her business of selling homemade food. Paula prepares traditional dishes at home and then sells them in the main square of the village of Ocongate. She is a hardworking woman who supports her household financially. Paula is requesting a loan so that she can invest in supplies for preparing traditional dishes.

She values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. For this reason, Paula promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing traditional dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of maize.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 35,  sells paint in her shop to earn a living. As the single mother of a 10-year-old, she saw the need to open another business so as to generate more income to afford the education of her child. This is why she started her mobile-phone money transfer business.
 
Susan has benefited from the financial education conducted by Faulu Kenya because she has improved her business. She hopes to open an art school for the teaching of painting in the future.  

Susan has requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to open another mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to open another mobile-phone money transfer business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 46 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Aquilina de 42 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes protege y cuida con mucho amor. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Víctor sale a trabajar en sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente en el cuidado de sus cultivos para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son, papa y arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus sembríos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que afectan a sus plantaciones. Para el futuro, desea comprar un carro con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Además de ayudarle en el trasladado de su mercadería de compra y venta de granos verdes en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta cuando llega esta temporada los precios de venta son muy altos, por ello comercializa los granos verdes en la capital del país donde obtiene un mejor pago por la venta de los mismos. Su principal dificultad es conseguir capital para invertir la mayor parte de su ganancia en la siembra y en su negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Víctor de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ganados como: toros y vacas, aprovechando que esta temporada no hay cosecha,  para poder criarlos y cebarlos para lograr revenderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Victor, age 46, resides in the village of Antabamba. He is known as a humble and hardworking father. Victor lives in his own home with his wife Aquilina, age 42, and their four young children who they protect and care for with much love. Every day, early in the morning, Victor leaves to work in the fields. For him, there are no days to rest because he must work continually to care for his crops so that he can have good production. His main products are potatoes and peas, which he sells in bulk in the city of Tarma. What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom he experiences working among his crops. He is able to freely enjoy a stroll through his green fields. Victor has been farming for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from swarms of insects that can affect their growth. In the future, he wants to buy a car so that he can transport his products to the wholesale market in Tarma. According to Victor, when prices are the highest, he sells his vegetables in the capital so that he can obtain the most earnings. His main difficulty has been setting aside enough capital from his earnings to invest in the planting season and in his business.

Victor is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Pinos de Antabamba” (The Pines of Antabamba) and will be receiving his sixth loan with MFP. He hopes that this financial support will help him achieve his goals. Once again, he promises to complete his repayments on time just as he did with his previous loans. Victor is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With this support, Victor will invest the money he requested in the purchase of cattle including bulls and cows. He plans to take advantage of this season to raise and fatten cattle since there are no crops to harvest. Victor hopes to resell the cattle at a good price.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and a cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, age 36, earns a living by making and selling clothing. She has been operating this business for four years. She works as hard as possible in her business so as to help her husband to support the family's household expenses. They have two children.

Gladys has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has managed to improve her business by adding business stock.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es comerciante de papa, chuño y tunta (chuño y tunta son derivados de la papa). El crédito lo requiere para comprar más de estos productos pues tiene una demanda muy fuerte, lo cual mejorará sus ingresos. Ella viaja a Desaguadero – frontera con Perú- para comprar dichos productos y los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Delia is a merchant who sells potatoes, “chuño”, and “tunta” (chuño and tunta are types of freeze-dried potatoes). The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more of these products since there is stronger demand. This will improve her income.

Delia travels to Desaguadero, which is along the border with Peru, in order to buy these products. She then sells them at the fairs in the city of El Alto. Delia is single and lives at the home of parents in the District of Alto Lima in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to purchase various potato products.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 35 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, donde se caracteriza por se un padre de familia extraordinario, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gisela de 35 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes quiere y apoya incondicionalmente. Desde joven se dedicó a la agricultura, principal actividad económica del lugar. En todo este tiempo ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante sus sembríos, es así que todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de papa, Choclos y zanahorias, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Pero se da un tiempo para dedicarse a trasportar carga desde las zonas altas donde se ubican los terrenos de cultivo, hasta la ciudad donde posteriormente se comercializarán. En adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Además de sacarle mucho provecho al apoyo que recibe de su banco comunal donde sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Alejandro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “andina” y “blanca”, donde espera obtener una producción de 30 sacos promedio.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 35, resides in the village of Antabamba and is known for being an extraordinary father. He lives in his own home with his wife Gisela, age 35, and their five beloved children who he wants to support unconditionally. Alejandro has been farming from a young age since agriculture is the main business activity in the area. Throughout this entire time, he has worked hard to become successful with his crops. Every morning, he wakes up very early to water and look after his crops of potatoes, corn, and carrots. He sells these products in the city of Tarma because that is where he is able to get the best prices for his crops. What he enjoys most about his job is enjoying the freedom of working in his green fields. Alejandro has been farming for 16 years and considers the most difficult part to be working the land every day because he does not have much time to devote to other activities. However, he makes time to transport his crops from the upper districts, where his farmland is located, to the city so that he can sell them. Going forward, he wants to prepare his land for planting peas since this crop currently sells the best. In addition, Alejandro hopes to take advantage of the support he receives from his Communal Bank because he knows that this loan will help him advance and develop his business.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Pinos de Antabamba” (The Pines of Antabamba). This is his sixth loan with MFP and he hopes that this assistance will help him achieve his goals. Alejandro is willing to submit his payments on time because the funds will be a great help in progressing and developing his business. He is a responsible member of his Communal Bank, which is why he is well-respected. With the assistance he received, Alejandro will invest the money he requested in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer for his next crop of potatoes of the “Andina” and “Blanca” varieties. He hopes that his production will average around 30 sacks of output.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa forma parte del banco comunal “Eben Ezer” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo artículos de bazar y paquetería en diferentes ferias libres. Teresa se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 12 años, su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras. Específicamente ropa interior. 
Con el crédito comprará calcetas, bufandas, pañuelos, toallas y ropa interior. 
Sus metas en su negocio son confeccionar ropa y posteriormente venderla, para esto necesita de un mayor capital para construir un taller en su casa. 
Teresa vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos, su yerno y su nieto. Sus sueños son brindarle a su familia una estabilidad socioeconómica y poder brindarle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad, para que sea un profesional.
Sus motivaciones son seguir adelante con su negocio, para concretar todos sus proyectos.
Teresa se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y esto le ha permitido generar mayores ganancias. Ella participa de las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal y se siente a gusto ya que la relación con los demás socios ha facilitado la solidaridad y confianza, además ha conocido nuevas experiencias. Respecto a las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones, Teresa comenta que cada día se aprende algo nuevo y ha podido aplicar estos nuevos aprendizajes en su propio negocio. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Ebenezer Communal Bank, which is in the community of Puente Alto in the city of Santiago. She is a retail merchant, selling bazaar goods and packaged products at different open fairs. Teresa has been in this trade for 12 years. Her merchandise is purchased from different distributors. The main products she sells are undergarments. With this loan, she will buy socks, scarves, handkerchiefs, towels, and undergarments. The goal for her business is to produce clothes that she can sell later, but she needs more capital to build a workshop in her house.

Teresa lives with her husband, her two children, a son-in-law, and a grandson. Her dreams are to provide her family with financial stability and giver her younger son the opportunity to study at the university so that he can become a professional. She is motivated to move forward with her business so that she can make all of her dreams a reality.

Teresa is very pleased and appreciative of the support provided by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business and generate more income. She participates in the Communal Bank meetings and feels at ease with the other members with whom she has developed unity and trust. As a result, she has been able to have new experiences. With respect to the training seminars that are provided at the meetings, Teresa says that she learns something new each day and is able to apply this knowledge to her own business.

Puente Alto is a community located to the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It was founded as a small rural town at the end of the 19th century. Given the growing demographics, it is now one of the largest cities in Chile with over 600,000 inhabitants. It is the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the Metropolitana region known as Cajón del Maipo. This area has space for hiking, horseback riding, rafting, and other activities, as well as lodging and dining services.

loans.use: to purchase socks, scarves, handkerchiefs, towels, and undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase powders, crèmes, perfumes, lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El señor Ángel es carpintero; realiza muebles a pedido y también entrega a mayoristas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de madera, clavos, selladora, y otros insumos. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Pedro Domingo Murillo en la ciudad de El Alto;  es separado   y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángel is a carpenter. He makes furniture upon request, but he also delivers his goods to wholesalers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood, nails, sealant, and other supplies. Ángel lives in a rental property in the District of Pedro Domingo Murillo in the city of El Alto. He is separated from his spouse and has two children.

This is the first loan Ángel has requested through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, sealant, and other supplies.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina has operated a poutry business for the past five years, selling both wholesale and from door to door to her neighbors. Her customers include hotel businesses and butcher shops. Georgina's primary business challenges are the high cost of chicken feed and the outbreak of disease. She dreams of expanding her business to better meet her customers' needs. 

Georgina and her husband have four sons, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Georgina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 70,000 loan, she plans to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 30 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Edith de 10 y Valentina de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de carne de Diana esta ubicado en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), su negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es muy concurrido por las personas y casi todos los días acaba con la mercadería que tenía planeado vender, lo cual la hace muy feliz, ya que sabe que ese dinero ayudará a su familia a tener una mejor vida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto de venta, soportando el intenso calor que hace, aun así no se desanima y sigue adelante. Anhela con el tiempo poner una carnicería más grande fuera del mercado, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos ustedes, por tanto sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne, para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Diana, age 27, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with Pedro, age 30. They have two beloved children, Edith (age 10) and Valentina (age 1), for whom they want to provide a better quality of life. Diana sells meat from a vending stall at the No. 2 Market (the largest market in the city of Pucallpa). Her business is very profitable since she is already well-known among many people. Just about every day, she sells all of the merchandise that she had planned, which makes her extremely happy. Diana knows that the money she earns will help her family have a better life. What she enjoys most about her job is talking with the other merchants about things that are happening at the market. She has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be remaining at her stall and withstanding the intense heat. Diana does not get discouraged, so she continues to press forward. Within time, she hopes to have a large butcher shop outside of the market in order to improve her income.

This will be her third loan with MFP. Diana hopes to receive everyone’s support. She knows that she must submit all of her payments on time so that does not cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, where she is well-respected. The loan of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more meat so that her vending stall can improve in its operation.

loans.use: to purchase meat to restock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 26 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He operates a cosmetic shop to earn a living. He has been operating the business for three years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money. This has helped him to manage his finances.

Isaac hopes to grow his business and become a well-known supplier of beauty products in his local community.  He needs 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair oil, nail polish and lotion.

loans.use: to buy hair oil, nail polish and lotion.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amor lo conforman la señora Dominga, Guadalupe, Maximo y wilber cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri, Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Dominga quien se dedica al comercio de perecederos en el mercado Oriental, el más grande de Nicaragua.

Ella con el crédito comprara cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada ya que esto le sale más barato.

 La señora Guadalupe desde hace cuatro años se dedica al comercio de ropa negocio que tiene el mercado Oriental, Máximo vende ropa en el mercado de Masaya y Wilber comercializa ropa de manera ambulante desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Amor (Love) group is comprised of Dominga, Guadalupe, Maximo, and Wilber, four hardworking and entrepreneurial people originally from Nindiri, Masaya.The group's coordinator is Dominga, who sells perishables in the Oriental market, the biggest one in Nicaragua.

She will use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables harvested in season, because they are least expensive.

Guadalupe has had a business selling clothes at the Oriental market for four years. Maximo sells clothes in the Masaya market, and Wilber has been a traveling clothes salesman for four years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables harvested in season

loans.name: Hermosas Group

texts.es:
Las Hermosas son un grupo solidario compuesto por 7 mujeres que acaban de recibir su primer prestamo en Credituyo. Ellas le pusieron este nombre al grupo porque dicen que esta es la palabra que mejor las describe, Hermosas (beautiful). La mayoria de las mujeres del grupo venden botana, tacos, snacks, zapatos y ropas. 

Sandra Patricia es una de las mujeres que integran el grupo. Sandra tiene 27 años y 4 hijos. De sus hijos 2 de ellos estan estuandio en la escuela primaria, 1 en el kinder y 1 todavia esta muy chico para entrar a estudiar. Sandra sueña que todos sus hijos continuen con sus estudios y que puedan llegar a estudiar una carrera profesional. Es por esto que hace 6 meses Sandra decidió abrir un negocio de venta de snacks en su casa. Ella uso el dinero de su credito para surtir su tienda y compro diversos productos como duritos, tostadas y dulces. Sandra espera que con las ganancias de estas ventas poco a poco pueda ir invirtiendo para poner una tienda de abarrotes más establecida.
texts.en:
Las Hermosas (The Lovelies) is a solid group comprised of seven women who have just received their first loan from Kiva partner Credituyo. They named their group the way they did because they say that this is the word that best describes them, Hermosas (beautiful). The majority of the women in the group sell snacks, tacos, shoes, and clothes.

Sandra Patricia is one of the women in the group. Sandra is 27 years old and has four children. Of her children, two of them are going to elementary school, one is in kindergarten, and one is still too young for school. Sandra dreams of all her children continuing their studies and that they will one day be able to study for a professional career. This is why six months ago, Sandra decided to open a business selling snacks out of her home. She used the money from her loan to stock her store and buy various products such as Doritos, tostadas, and sweets. Sandra hopes that with the revenue from her sales, she will be able to invest little by little so that she can start a more established grocery store.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise to sell through her snack business

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es: El señor Teodocio es costurero; se dedica a confeccionar gorras y sombreros para toda edad las mismas las comercializa en la feria de la calle Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: tela, hilos, bordados y demás, con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco en la Ciudad de El Alto. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues es cliente nuestro desde el año 2009.
texts.en: Teodocio is a tailor; he makes caps and hats for all ages, which he sells at the market on Tumusla street in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting is for purchasing materials such as fabric, thread, embroidery, etc. Through this business, he covers his family's household expenses. He lives in his own home, which is located in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. He is very satisfied with the loans he has received before. He has been our client since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, embroidery, and lining for making caps and hats, which is his specialty

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Manuel de 47 años y su querida hija Tracy de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La venta de carne le ha dado a Gilda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, ella tiene su puesto en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que la carne que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa, lo cual le ha hecho una buena fama y le trae mucho clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre la carne que más sabor le dará a sus comidas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero es parte del sacrificio para poder ganar más dinero. Espera con el tiempo tener una carnicería más grande en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne para implementar su negocio, ya que últimamente la demanda ha crecido.
texts.en: Gilda, 42 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Manuel, who is 47, and her beloved daughter Tracy, who is five. She wants to give them a better quality of life. Selling meat has given Gilda the necessary income to support her family. Her stand is in the N° 2 Market (and important market in the city of Pucallpa), which is very well visited since the meat that she sells is very fresh and flavorful. This has given her a good reputation and brings her many customers. The thing she most likes about her work is getting to know her customers over the meat that will give all their meals more flavor. She has been in this business for 20 years, and the thing she finds most difficult about it is having to stay at her stand all day without being able to leave. This is, however, part of the sacrifice necessary for making more money. She hopes that in time she will have a bigger butcher shop where she can serve more customers. This will be her fourth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes for all of your support in realizing her goals. She is a very active and loyal member of her community bank, which is why she is so respected by the other members. With the 1,000 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will purchase more meat for her business, since demand has recently grown.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to stock up her business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Dora; tiene 34 años de edad; la socia tiene 5 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comidas caseras típicas de la región;  la asocia elabora sus comidas típicas en su casa y los lleva a vender en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate, junto a sus otras compañeras de banco comunal y vecinas de trabajo;  la socia  suele llevar platos diferentes a las de sus compañeras para que no tengan competencia, ellas se ponen de acuerdo y varían sus menús diarios; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como arroz, aceite, sal y otros ingredientes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the "Sr. de Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Dora is 34 years old and has five children.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling home-made meals that are typical of her region.  She makes the meals at home and takes them to sell in the main square in the village of Ocangate, together with the fellow members of her community bank and those who work in the same area.  Dora usually makes different dishes to those of her friends so that they don't cause competition for each other.  They come to an agreement and vary their daily menus.  Dora would like this loan to invest in buying supplies such as rice, oil, salt and other ingredients.

Dora values her loan and is infinitely grateful for it since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She therefore pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying supplies such as rice, oil, salt and other ingredients

loans.name: Brenda Del Pilar

texts.es: Brenda Del Pilar de 28 años. Brenda posee una pulpería en los cuales comercializa productos de primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro de un hogar. Ella cuenta con 12 años de poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual disminuye en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder invertir y comprar pastas, sopas, fósforos, crema y granos básicos  para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee.
texts.en:
Brenda Del Pilar is 28 years old.  Brenda has a grocery store where she sells basic needs products like pasta, bread, eggs, and others that are fundamental to a household.  She has had her business for 12 years.  It has allowed her to improve her family finances.  On many occasions their finances are pretty bad.  This is mostly because she often does not have all of the products that people are looking for.  This greatly decreases her earnings.

That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to be able to buy pasta, soup, matches, cream, and basic grains.  She will do this to be able to stock her business with the products that she needs but does not have.

loans.use: to be able to buy pasta, soup, matches, cream, and basic grains.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry es empleado en una empresa de grúas y montacargas y los fines de semana ayuda a su madre a vender CD en distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá los gastos de trámite de licencia de conducir. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y no tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Henry is employed by a crane and lift company.  On the week-ends he helps his mother sell CDs at different fairs in the city of El Alto.

He will use the loan to cover the fees to get his driver’s license.

He lives in his own house in the Villa Esperanza zone in the city of El Alto.  He is married, but he does not have children.

loans.use: to pay the fees for getting his driver's license.

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Antonela está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias del reparto Martin Castellón en la zona urbana de Nindirí. Este grupo tiene 11 préstamos con Adim y tres con Kiva, en los cuales sus negocios han mejorado y se han perfilado como excelentes clientes.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lea de 37 años, tiene tres hijos los cuales son su motivación para salir adelante. Ella se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata negocio que poco a poco ha ido desarrollando en el cual invertirá el crédito en mercadería.

Las otras integrantes del grupo Claudia María se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, Ana es comerciante de ropa (pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños…etc.) y Arely desde hace 7 años vende prendas de oro y plata.
texts.en:
The Antonela group consists of four hardworking and enterprising women from the Martin Castellón neighborhood in the municipality of Nindirí.  They have had 11 loans with ADIM and three with Kiva in which their businesses have improved and they have achieved excellent client profiles.

The group coordinator is Lea, 37.  She has three children and they are her motivation to get ahead.  She sells gold and silver jewelry and little by little her business has been growing.

The other group members are Claudia María who sells cosmetics, Ana who sells clothing (pants, shirts, children’s items, etc), and Arely who has been selling gold and silver jewelry for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry of gold and silver jewelry (rings, bracelets, chains, etc)

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 35 years old and married. He has three children. He has been selling cosmetics for the past seven years. Simon was previously selling fruits. He joined a group registered under Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and have access to business loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other loans.  

Simon has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy body oil, perfumes and soap.

loans.use: to buy body oil, perfumes and soap.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa, de 69 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ignacio de 70 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana Josefa abre su tienda para atender a sus clientes, quienes saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse en su barrio y corren a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella los atiende muy bien y siempre es muy cortes con las personas, ya que sabe que de ello depende para vender y ganar más dinero. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir, pero sabe que es parte del negocio si desea establecerse bien como comerciante. Anhela crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este será su décimo tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para afianzarse como negociante. Del mismo promete cumplir a tiempo sus cuotas. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, implementará mejor su tienda de abarrotes, para brindarles una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josefa, 69, is an unassuming, kind woman living in her own house with her husband, Ignacio, 70.  What she most wants is to live a peaceful old age.  

Josefa opens her store around 6am to start taking care of customers who know that her store is the first one that opens in the neighborhood so they run there to buy what they need.  She tends to them very well and is always very courteous with the people because she knows this is what her selling more and earning more money depends on.  What she most likes about her business is chatting with the customers.  She’s been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay inside the store all day unable to go out.  But, she knows that this is part of the business she has to do if she wants to establish herself well as a merchant.

She hopes to expand the business and provide better service to her customers.  This will be her 13th loan with MFP so she hopes to get all of your support to cement herself as a businesswoman.  In the same way, she promises to pay her installments on time.  She will use the 1200 new soles she’s requesting to better stock her store to provide a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Laure Abajo Group

texts.en:
Saturnina, Maria Suyapa, and Claudia Carolina, who reside in the San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the Laure Abajo solidarity group in June, 2011. They will collectively serve as guarantors of one another's loans. Maria Suyapa sells snacks and refreshments and is requesting a loan of LPS 8,000 with which to purchase a refrigerator. The refrigerator will enable her to sell frozen items, such as chocolate-covered bananas, which are very popular in her area. 

Claudia Carolina sells basic foodstuffs out of her home and is requesting a loan of LPS 5,000 to purchase merchandise. Saturnina runs a small convenience shop where she sells basic foodstuffs and household supplies. She is requesting a loan of LPS 8,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra.  Norma participo en el banco de emprendimiento Calicanto, ahora sacando un  crédito de manera individual, es una personas responsable y trabajadora, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los mercados, zonas y también en oficinas, la cliente es dueña de casa y su domicilio queda ubicado en la zona Calicanto, separada desde hace mucho tiempo,  con 2 hijos independientes, este crédito es para aumentar su mercadería comprando ropa de invierno para esta época de frio ya que sus clientes ya le están haciendo pedidos.
texts.en:
Norma participated in the Calicanto communal bank but is now taking out an individual loan.  She is a responsible, hard working person.  Her economic activity is clothing sales in various markets, neighborhoods and also in offices.  

She owns her house which is located in the Calicanto neighborhood.  She’s been separated for a long time and has two independent children.  

This loan is to increase her merchandise buying winter clothes for this cold season because her customers are already placing orders.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza y venta de productos de belleza, ella en un salón de belleza hace teñidos, ondulaciones y cortes de cabello, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza y el negocio de ventas de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes, tijeras y ruleros y también para comprar productos de belleza como lápices labiales, perfumes y cremas.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She is 40 years old and lives with her spouse; she has three children.

She alternates her daily chores with running a beauty salon and selling beauty products.  In the salon she does hair coloring, hair curling and hair cuts.  She works from 9am until 8pm and she is able to support her children through this business.  She would like to expand and improve the beauty salon business and the business selling beauty products.  She is asking for a loan to buy hair color, scissors and rollers and also to buy beauty products like lipstick, perfume and creams.

She is happy with the loan and committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to buy hair color, scissors and rollers and also to buy beauty supplies like lipsstick, perfume and creams.

loans.name: Casa Hamaquera Group

texts.es:
El grupo Casa Hamaquera lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras y trabajadoras originarias de  Masaya considera la cuna del Folklor nicaragüense. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Evangelina quien fabrica manila y hamacas. Este es un negocio que se ha desarrollado de generación en generación en su familia.

Ella acaba de ser beneficiada por parte de Adim en la formulación de su plan de negocio con el cual mejoro su taller. Evangelina con el crédito compara materia prima para su negocio.

Las otras integrantes son Dalia y Eva quienes también se dedican a la  fabrican hamacas de todos los colores y formas. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para mejorar y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Casa Hamaquera” group is made of three enterprising and hard working women from Masaya, considered to be the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore.  

The group coordinator is Evangelina.  She makes hammocks and Manila hammocks.  This is a business that’s been developed in her family generation to generation.  She recently was benefitted by Adim with the development of her business plan.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials for her business.

The other group members are Dalia and Eva who also make hammocks in all shapes and colors.  They will use the loan to improve their businesses and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy hammock making raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Joven Maria Elena de 30 años es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Maria se dedica hace3 años a la venta de recargas. Ella inicio este negocio como un pasatiempo, pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado incrementar su inventario. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de sacar adelante a su familia.  El motivo del crédito es para la compra de recargas de diferentes cantidades de 10 córdobas hasta de 200. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable para poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Elena is 30 years old and a single mother of one minor son in her care.  For the last three years she’s been selling cell phone recharge cards.  She started the business as a hobby but in time she’s managed to increase her inventory.

She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys moving her family ahead.  The reason for the loan is to buy phone recharge cards in denominations ranging from 10 córdobas to 200.  Her dream is to have a stable business in order to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards in denominations from 10 córdobas to 200.

loans.name: Sheku A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun, in Kenema city. This school was founded in 2004, by a charitable Islamic Organization, to improve education in the community. Teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested for a loan of SLL 5,200,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salary can not let them accomplish.

Sheku is the leader of the group. Sheku is age fifty. He was born in a place call Padembu. Sheku is married and has three children. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty-one years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs and bags of cement.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Massah, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron, corrugated zincs and bags of cement.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Homero de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad diaria de Julia es la venta de carne, tiene su puesto en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que siempre vende carne de muy buena calidad, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero es parte del trabajo y del sacrificio para poder ganar más dinero. En  adelante desea tener una carnicería más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda cumplir sus sueños. Además desea cumplir con el pagos de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en: Julia, 40 years old, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house alongside her husband, Homero, 47, and their three dear children to whom they wish to provide a better quality of life. Julia's daily activity is selling meat. She has a stall in the No 2 market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa), which is very busy, since she always sells meat of very good quality. She is a very happy seller and receives her customers with a smile on her lips. What she likes most about her work is to converse with her neighboring sellers.  She has been doing this work for 13 years and considers having to stay at her stall all day without being able to leave the most difficult part. However, it's part of the work and of the sacrifice to be able to earn more money. In the future, she wishes to have a larger meat shop where she can attend to her customers better. This will be the fifteenth loan with MFP, so she hopes for the support of all of you so that she can achieve her dreams. In addition, she wishes to make her payments on time. In her community bank, she is a trustworthy and united member. With the 2,000 new "soles" requested, she will buy more meat to stock her stall better.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabina de internet y de juegos de play station, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cabina de internet y de juegos de play station. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la cabina de internet para hacer arreglar las computadoras y comprar repuestos. 

                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 34 years old and lives with a partner and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with an Internet cafe and Playstation games business. She works from 8AM until 11PM. Through this business,  she gets her children ahead. The member wishes to expand and improve the Internet cafe and Playstation game business. The member is requesting the loan so she can fix computers and buy spare parts at the Internet cafe.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to start an internet cabin to fix computers and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Bertha; tiene 54 años de edad; la socia es viuda y tiene 9 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comidas caseras típicas de esta región;  la asocia elabora sus comidas típicas y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate, la socia trabaja con otras compañeras socias del banco comunal y vecinas de trabajo;  la socia  suele preparar las comiditas caseras con previa anticipación para dar los últimos toques en la plaza principal, ellas coordinan los diferentes  platos con sus compañeras para que no tengan competencia, ellas se ponen de acuerdo y varían sus menús diarios; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como arroz, aceite, sal y otros ingredientes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
