The member belongs to the "Sr. De Tayancani' Community Bank. The member lives in the Ocongate district in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

The member, Bertha, is 54 years old. She is a widow and has nine children and she alternates her activities at home with the sale of typical home-cooked food of the region. The member makes her typical dishes and sells them in the main square of the Ocongate village. The member works with other women who are members of the community bank and working neighbors. The member prepares her dishes with prior notice and gives the final touches in the main square. She coordinates the different dishes with her colleagues so that they're not competing. They agree and vary their daily menus. The member wants the loan to invest in the purchase of inputs such as rice, oil, salt and other ingredients.

The member values and is infinitely thankful for the loan granted since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to make her payments at the stipulated deadlines.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of inputs like rice, oil, salt and other ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Desde pequeño Luis Alberto ha conocido la ley del rebusque, pues desde los 8 años cuando su padre salía con él a vender dulces en la calle aprendió a ser emprendedor e independiente, desde muy joven aprendió a hacer artesanías, oficio que lo convirtió en su propio negocio y que desde hace algunos años ejerce en el Centro de Medellín donde ofrece los productos que elabora a los transeúntes. 
 
Luis trabaja de lunes a sábado hasta las 7:30 de la noche con el fin de hacerse a buenas ventas y lograr ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para materia prima como cuero, hilos, entre otros implementos que le permitirán mejorar su producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Since he was young, Luis Alberto has known the law of moonlighting. Since he was 8 when his father went out with him to sell sweets in the street, he learned to be entrepreneurial and independent. Since he was young, he learned to make crafts, a job that he made into his own business and, for some years, he has worked at in the Medellin Center where he offers the products he makes to bystanders.

Luis works from Monday to Saturday until 7:30 at night when making good sales ends and he makes income to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Currently, he needs a loan for raw material like leather, thread, among other things that will allow him to improve his production and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make crafts.

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Monte Verde está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es la señora Juana Mercedes quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya desde hace más de 2 años. Ella con el préstamo comprara cosechas de perecederos de temporada. 
Los otros integrantes son Lizett Marbelly y Rogelio José se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en: The group, Monte Verde, is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people. One of them is Juana Mercedes who has been dedicated to the sale of fruit and vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Masaya for more than two years. With the loan, she will buy perishable seasonal crops. The other members are Lizett Marbelly and Rogelio Jose who are dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal perishables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en el seguro social en el área de nutrición, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para su casa.    
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 24 years old and is single. The member alternates her daily activities with work in social security in the area of nutrition. The member works from 8AM until 4PM. She wishes to continue improving in her work. She is requesting the loan to buy furniture for her house.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.name: Trinidad 	Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Trinidad es cliente antigua de "emprender"  que esta en su   sexta secuencia de su crédito la cliente vende pescado crudo, vive  en la zona Munaypata,  tiene 2 hijos que dependen de la  Sra. Trinidad es casada  con el Sr. Jorge,  su esposo es mensajero  que trabaja en una institución. La Sra. Trinidad  trabaja sacrificadamente  para salir adelante con su negocio en venta de pescados. El préstamo esta solicitando para  comprar mercadería por mayor pescado por cantidad, es un apersona muy buena y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Trinidad is an old client of "Emprender", who is in her sixth loan cycle. The client sells raw fish. She lives in the Munaypata area. She has two children who depend on her. She's married to Jorge. Her husband is a messenger who works at an institution. Trinidad works sacrificially to get ahead with her business selling fish. The loan that she is requesting is to purchase merchandise, a greater quantity of fish. She a very good and hard-working person who is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase raw fish.

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es:
Ania es una joven, que se ha proyectado en las ventas, desde hace tres años logro poner una pulpería, con dinero de su trabajo, y ahorros que su esposo dio. En donde ha venido surtiendo con productos nuevos, gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado. Logrando aumentar las ventas.
Está contenta ya que pronto nacerá su hijo, y es un gozo. Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bidón de aceite, gaseosas, cosméticos, productos de limpiezas, golosinas entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes. Logrando tener mejores ganancias ya que tendrá que gastar mucho con la venida de su bebe.
texts.en: Ania is a young woman who works in retail sales. Three years ago she managed to set up a general store with money earned from her job and savings given to her by her husband. She has used her Afodenic loans to stock her shop with new products. She has succeeded in increasing her sales. She is happy as her baby is due soon and it will be a great pleasure for her. She will invest this new loan in buying basic grains, such as rice, sugar, beans, tins of cooking oil, sodas, cosmetics, cleaning products, sweets and other products required by her customers. Consequently she hopes to make a greater profit as she will have to spend a great deal of money once her baby arrives.

loans.use: Will buy basic grains, sweets, fizzy drinks and cosmetics to help increase her sales.

loans.name: Azucenas Blancas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Azucenas Blancas lo conforman Ruth, Issel y Rosaura tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Niquinomo. Este grupo han tenido dos préstamos en Adim en los cuales han mostrado ser responsables y laboriosas. 
La coordinadora  es la señora Ruth quien se dedica al comercio de desde hace cinco años. Ella tiene dos hijos que son su mayor motivación para salir adelante. Con el crédito comprará artesanías para aumentar su mercadería. 
La señora Issel desde hace 2 años comercializa artesanía y bisutería, y Rosaura se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Ruth, Issel and Rosaura belong to the Azucenas Blancas group. These are three hard-working and entrepreneurial women originally from Niquinomo. This group has aready had two loans with ADIM and proved themselves to be responsible and hard-working women.
Ruth is their coordinator, she has been in business for the last 5 years. She has 2 children who are her primary motivation for success. She will use this loan to buy handicrafts and increase her range of stock. Issel has been selling handicrafts and costume jewellery for the last 2 years, and Rosaura sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: A sus 67 años de edad, Juan José es un hombre vital y emprendedor, pues desde hace muchos años cuando se quedó desempleado y debido a la falta de oportunidades y a la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia decidió darle vida a su negocio, una cafetería ubicada en Itagüí Colombia. En el sector Juan José es reconocido pero en el futuro espera que su negocio crezca aun mucho más. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para adquirir más surtido y así ofrecer mayor diversidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Juan José is 67, full of life and a hard worker.  He has run his own business for many years, which he opened to support his family during an era of few economic opportunities.  He runs a small cafetería in Itagüí Colombia which now has quite a following; Juan Jose hopes to grow his business further in the future.  He seeks this credit to buy additional merchandise to offer better variety to his customers and to increase sales.

loans.use: to increase merchandise inventory for store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 75 pieces of traditional African wax fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 60 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant y también es director de grupo musical llamado Rico Corazon, el es propietario y anima bautizos, matrimonios y cumpleaños, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia, el socio quiere terminar de grabar su cds de música. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su grupo musical y también para comprar materiales para terminar de grabar su cds.
                                                  
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 60 years old, married, and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his restaurant business.  He is also the manager of a band called "Rico Corazón".  He is the owner of the band and they liven up christenings, weddings and birthday parties.  Through this business, he gets his family ahead in life.  The borrower would like to finish recording some music CDs.  He is requesting this loan to equip his band and also buy materials so that he can finish recording their CDs.

The borrower is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip his band and to buy materials to finish recording their CDs

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 30 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has five years of experience in operating the business.  Besides her shop, she also works as a teacher to earn extra income.  

Pauline has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has learned how to manage her business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  She has requested for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.use: to  buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 18 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El puesto de carne de Julia esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), su negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es muy concurrido por las personas y casi todos los días acaba con la mercadería que tenía planeado vender, lo cual la hace muy feliz, ya que sabe que ese dinero ayudará a su familia a tener una mejor vida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo manifiesta que este trabajo es muy agotador, pero debe hacerlo si desea ganar más dinero. Ahora su fin es tener una carnicería más grande en las afueras del mercado, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con su propósito. Asimismo se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne, para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
18 year-old Julia is a very kind and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home and is prepared to work very hard to improve her quality of life.

Julia's butcher shop is located in Bellavista market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa).  Her business is very profitable as it is very busy and almost every day she sells all the merchandise that she planned to sell.  This makes her very happy because she knows that the money will help her family to have a better life.

What Julia most enjoys about her work is chatting to neighboring saleswomen about things that happen in the market.  She has been in this business for three years and she says that the work is exhausting.  However, she must do it if she wants to make more money.  Julia's current goal is to own a larger butcher shop on the outskirts of the market which would enable her to improve her income.

This will be Julia's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in achieving her goal.  For her part, she pledges to make all her repayments on time so that she doesn't inconvenience the other members of her community bank where she is a very well-liked member.  Julia will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more meat with which to better stock her sales location.

loans.use: to buy more meat to stock her business

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Agusta; tiene 37 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia elabora telares, ella realiza mantas de todo tamaño, así como ponchos, chullos, guantes entre otros trabajos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales tales como lanas de alpaca, y tintes naturales para teñir las lanas de diferentes colores, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de mantas y vender.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Augusta is a member of the "Sr. De Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Augusta is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling handicrafts.  Augusta weaves products with a loom.  She makes blankets in all sizes.  She also makes ponchos, 'chullos' (woolen hats with ear flaps), gloves and other items.  She needs this loan to invest in buying materials such as alpaca yarn and natural dyes for dying her yarn different colors.  She needs this loan to invest in buying materials for making blankets to sell.

Augusta appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful for it as it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making blankets to sell

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fernando de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Lida es la venta de ropa, todos los días camina hasta la casa de sus compradores, a quienes entrega las prendas que le han solicitado con anterioridad, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre atiende a sus compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para elegir su horario de trabajo, ya que también tiene que dedicarles tiempo a sus queridos hijos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la ropa que vende, ya que la trae desde la ciudad de Lima. Para el futuro, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con más tranquilidad. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración de todos ustedes para poder cumplir sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y activa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de  prendas para escoger.
texts.en:
Lida is 42 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 42 year-old Fernando, and her four beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Lida's business is selling clothes.  Every day she walks to her customers' houses to deliver the clothes that they have previously requested from her.  She is a very cheerful saleswoman who always serves her customers with a smile on her face.  What Lida most enjoys about her work is the freedom that she has to choose her own working hours since she also has to make time for her beloved children.  Lida has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting the clothes that she sells since she brings them from the city of Lima.  In the future, she hopes to set up a store where she can sell her merchandise more peacefully.

This will be Lida's seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes that you will all will work with her to help her achieve her goals.  Lida is a very cheerful and active member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she can offer her customers larger variety of clothes to choose from.

loans.use: to buy more clothes so that she can offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel for making concrete blocks.

loans.name: Crhistian Felipe

texts.es: Vocación y perseverancia son las palabras que describen a Christian quien desde muy joven supo que lo suyo sería tener un salón de belleza, fue entonces cuando estaba en colegio cuando aprovechaba su tiempo libre para aprender este oficio al lado de un amigo que tenía una barbería y quien le enseñó las diferentes técnicas. Hoy a sus 21 años de edad y con la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, este joven espera reabrir su negocio, el cual se vio obligado a cerrar debido a los problemas de violencia que enfrentó su barrio, para ello Crhistian necesita de un préstamo para comprar máquinas de motilar, cuchillas, peinillas y algunos insumos como gomina y otros productos necesarios para su labor.
texts.en:
Vocation and perseverance are the words that describe Christian.  From a very young age, he knew that he would own a beauty salon.  When he was in high school, he made the most of his spare time to learn this trade alongside a friend who owned a barber's shop and taught him the different techniques.

Christian is now 21 and, with the hope of improving his quality of life and being able to offer his family a better future, this young man hopes to re-open his business which he had to close down owing to problems of violence in his neighborhood.  Christian needs a loan so that he can buy haircutting tools, razors, combs and some supplies such as hair gel and other products that he needs for his work.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies to re-open his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, cheese, eggs, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, cooking oil, personal hygiene products and household cleaning products.

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es:
Después de probar suerte como el mismo lo llama en Ecuador, buscando oportunidades para mejorar su calidad de vida, César Augusto decidió volver a Colombia con la esperanza de salir adelante, fue entonces cuando después de buscar empleo sin encontrar, decidió crear su propio negocio cría y engorde de aves para la comercialización de huevos y gallinas, fue entonces cuando con lo poco que tenía arrendó una finca en San Pedro de los Milagros al Norte de Antioquia, donde tiene su galpón. 
 
César espera convertirse en uno de los distribuidores de huevos más grande de la región y para ello trabaja fuertemente todos los días en busca de lograr su sueño. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar incubadora propia para las aves, codornices, gallinas ponedoras, mallas, maderas y focos para adecuar otro galpón y empezar a crecer poco a poco.
texts.en:
After trying his luck (as he himself puts it) in Ecuador, looking for opportunities to improve his quality of life, César Augusto decided to return to Colombia in the hopes of getting ahead in life.  After looking for a job but not finding one, he decided to set up his own business raising and fattening birds in order to sell eggs and hens.  With the little money he had, he rented land in San Pedro de los Milagros, in the north of Antioquia.  This is where he has his chicken shed.

César hopes to become one of the biggest egg distributors in the region and so he works hard every day in order to achieve his dream.  He currently needs a loan to buy his own incubator for the birds, quails and laying hens.  He will buy wire netting, wood and lamps in order to fit out another chicken shed and start to grow bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy an incubator and supplies for looking after his birds

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma y su esposo el señor Hector tienen ya mas de 26 años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera y venta de ellos.
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que a su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas materia como es madera, pegamento, clavos y pinturas para la madera, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la inversión que necesitan, ya que tiene varios pedidos de muebles para elaborar y por falta del material no han podido entregar estos pedidos a tiempo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Emma and her husband Hector have been making and selling wooden furniture for 26 years.

They are requesting a loan as their business needs more material such as wood, adhesive, nails and wood paint but they do not have the money they need to invest.  They have several orders for furniture and, owing to a lack of material, they haven't been able to deliver these orders on time.

Emma plans to repay her loan with some of the profits that she makes in her business since this is the source of income that she has for her family.

loans.use: to buy material for her business

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Alonso de 9 y Casandra de 10 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En un pequeño cuarto Lizbeth ha adecuado su taller de manualidades, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan, ella es muy solicitada por sus clientes, ya que las manualidades que realiza son de muy buena calidad y muy creativas actualmente se encuentra trabajando figuras de corrospum, las cuales moldea con gran dedicación.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar sus manualidades en la tranquilidad de su hogar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los pequeños detalles en los acabados de las figuras. Con el tiempo, espera poner una tienda muy grande por el centro de la ciudad, ya que actualmente solo trabaja a pedido. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra y contagia. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más materiales, para elaborar nuevas figuras.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 36 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children, 9 year-old Alonso and 10 year-old Casandra, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Lizbeth has set up a craft workshop in a small room.  Every day she works from very early in the morning filling the orders that people have made with her.  Her work is very much in demand with her customers since the handicrafts that she makes are very good quality and very creative.  Currently, she is making figures from 'corrospum' (a micro-porous material similar to plastic) which she models with great dedication.

What Lizbeth most enjoys about her work is the fact that she can make her handicrafts in the peace of her own home.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be putting all the small details into the finishing touches of her figures.  Over time, she hopes to set up a very big store in the city center since currently she only works to order.  This will be her ninth loan from MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her community bank.  She is a very well-liked member of her group for her cheerfulness which is contagious.

Lizbeth will use the 1,800 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more materials so that she can make new figures.

loans.use: to buy 'corrospum' (a micro-porous material similar to plastic) for making new educational designs

loans.name: Amor Y Paz En Dios Group

texts.en:
Candida is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Paz en Dios - "Love and Peace in God". She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most important challenges are to work hard in her business and to improve it. Her dreams are to have a supermarket and to give to her family a better life.

Candida is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 6 years, starting with a grocery stall in her house. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally, these colmados are in the same neighborhood as homes, or short walking distances from any home. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to proviD. certain necessities. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she was searching for loans to start doing business. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is free trading zone, a cement factory, and others.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned meal, etc.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesús

texts.es: La calle es el lugar donde Orlando tiene su negocio, pues desde hace algunos años se dedica a las ventas ambulantes de dulces en Itagüí Antioquia y aunque ya es conocido en el sector por el que transitan personas que se dirigen hacia sus trabajos, conductores de buses y universitarios, Orlando espera mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, para ello desea agregarle a su negocio frutas, pues considera que así logrará ofrecer más opciones para sus clientes, para ello necesita de un préstamo y así crecer poco a poco y seguir adelante.
texts.en: The street is the place where Orlando has his business.  He has been selling candy as a street vendor in Itagüí Antioquuia and he is known in the area by people, such as bus drivers and university employees, who pass by on their way to work.  Orlando hopes to increase his income so he can improve his quality of life.  He wants to add fruits to his business so that he can offer his customers more options.  For this he needs a loan and in this way he can grow little by little and get ahead.

loans.use: increase his stock and diversify the products he carries.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
  Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es ropa para hombre, niños, accesoria para bebe y quiere también vender aparatos electrónicos. 
Doña Esperanza espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que para ella es muy importante, porque es la fuente de ingreso para su familia. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y que sus clientes puedan encontrar sus necesidades de vestir con ella.
texts.en: Señora Esperanza has been selling used clothing in various parts of the city for more than three years .  She is requesting a loan as she needs to add more variety to her merchandise such as clothing for men and children and baby accessories.  She also wants to sell electronic devices.  Doña Esperanza hopes to have your support with this loan since it is very important for her because this is her family's source of income.  She wants to improve her business and she also wants her customers to be able to find the clothing they need with her.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: El Limoncito Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Limoncito" esta ubicado enfrente D. una gran presa, la gente pesca por la mañanas y tambien la presa cumple la funcion D. abastecer las milpas D. cultivo, por lo tanto son milpas D. riego, el grupo el limoncito obtubo un credito para invertirlo en el comercio, son 9 mujeres que integran el grupo una D. ellas es la señora Maria Rosalba que va invertir su prestamo en comprar una maquina D. coser llamada (Over), la señora Maria se dedica hacer costuras con su maquina D. coser, pero tiene un problema y es que su actual maquina es un modelo atrasado y nesecita uno mas reciente que le pueda ayudar para hacer ropa y un mejor trabajo, un ejemplo es que doña Maria tiene que entregar unos vestidos que se comprometio hacerlos para unas niñas y puedan salir en un baile, ella platica que sabe hacer cosas mas sencillas y siempre era lo que hacia, pero ahora tiene que haer vestidos y no es nada facil, por eso nesecita la maquina nueva, el prestamo le va ayudar para que pueda invertirlo y siga trabajando, es la unica manera para que salga dinero y cubra sus nesecidades diarias,  una D. sus metas es que la conoscan por su trabajo y comprar la maquina que quiere para su trabajo, la señora Maria es madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor es un hombre que esta casado, los siguientes hijos estan estudiando la preparatoria y la secundaria, doña Maria tiene 35 años D. edad y 22 años D. casada, vive en casa propia, su marido trabaja en sitio D. taxis, D. esta forma su marido y doña Mary es como obtienen ganancias para su casa y sus hijos en la escuela. Los nombre del resto del grupo el Limoncito son los siguientes: 
1.-Virginia, tiene un puesto D. dulces
2.-Rosa, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes
3.-Miryam, tienD. una tienda escolar
4.-Maria Elena, tiene un negocio D. plantas
5.-Rosa Isela, venD. cokteles D. fruta
6.-Leticia, venD. zapatos por catalogo
7.-Lorenza, venD. Elotes en la noche
8.-Jazmin, venD. ropa por catalogo
texts.en:
The "Limoncito" group is located opposite a large reservoir.  People fish there in the mornings and the reservoir also serves the purpose of supplying water to fields of crops.  They are irrigated fields.  The Limoncito group obtained a loan to invest in their businesses.  There are nine women in the group.  One of them is Maria Rosalba who will invest her loan in buying an overlock sewing machine.  Maria does sewing work with her machine but she has a problem: her current machine is an old model and she needs a more recent one that will help her to make clothes and do better work.  For example, Maria has to deliver some dresses that she promised to make for some young girls so that they can go out to a dance.  She tells us that she knows how to do simpler pieces of work and that was what she always used to do, however, now she has to make dresses which is no easy matter.  This is why she needs a new machine.  She will use her loan to invest in this and continue working.  This is the only way that she has for making money and covering her daily needs.  Maria's goals are to become known for her work and to buy the machine that she would like for carrying out her work.

Maria is the mother of four children.  Her eldest son is already a grown up and married, the other children are attending elementary school and high school.  Maria is 35 years old and has been married for 22 years.  She lives in her own home and her husband works as a taxi driver.  This is how Maria and her husband make profits for their household and to support their children's education.

The other members of the Limoncito group are:
1. Virginia - who has a stall selling sweet treats.
2. Rosa - who has a grocery store.
3. Miryam - who has a school snack bar.
4. Maria Elena - who has a plant business.
5. Rosa Isela - who sells fruit salads.
6. Leticia - who sells shoes through a catalog.
7. Lorenza - who sells corncobs in the evening.
8. Jazmin - who sells clothes through a catalog.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiene más de dos años con su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar material que le esta haciendo falta que es platas, vasos, ollas donde preparar los guisados y varios alimentos. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio requiere.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Felipe se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos, con las ganancias de su negocio que el tiene.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has had her business of making and selling food for over two years.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials that she needs.  She will buy plates, glasses, and pots to prepare stews and various other foods.  She does not now have the money that is needed to make the investment that her business needs.

She will pay back the loan with the earnings she gets from her business.  Her husband, Felipe, will take charge of the family expenses and the school expenses for her children with his income from the business that he has.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, and pots to prepare stews and various other foods.

loans.name: Wendy Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Wendy, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, México, está integrado por la señora Rosa va a comprar con su crédito tomates, chiles, jitomates, la señora Ana María va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo, las señoras María Magdalena y Margarita van a comprar blusas, pantalones camisas, la señora María de Lourdes va a comprar garrafones de agua y refrescos. La señora Ana María tiene 25 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene 3 hijos Miguel Ángel de 6 años de edad, Wendy de 4 años de edad y José Mereció de 2 años de edad, ella vende zapatos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar sandalias, zapatillas, botas, tenis y zapatos de niños y una parte del préstamo para la comida, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años y medio por que le gusta vender, desde chica ha trabajado en zapaterías, su esposo le lleva los zapatos para vender como él trabaja en zapatería de ahí le surte su mercancía,  ella sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, su negocio es importante porque si le saca algo de ahí toma para la comida y se siente contenta de conocer más gente y se distrae, ella está feliz con este préstamo que le van a dar porque va a comprar zapatos para surtir y tener que ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanzas son  que sus niños estén bien que no les falte nada. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Muchas gracias por sus préstamos y que nos sigan ayudando a crecer los negocio y las familias”. Anenecuilco es un pueblo bonito  hay cerros siembran caña, maíz, se localiza la casa museo donde nació Emiliano Zapata, hay documentos, utensilio que uso, fotos, pasan una película de la historia de Emiliano Zapata, el 8 de Agosto celebran el natalicio con una velada en la primaria hay bailables, cantantes, a las 11:00 Pm encienden antorchas y se van a dar mañanitas a la casa de Zapata  con mariachi.
texts.en:
Wendy is the name of this comunal bank, which is located in the Anenecuilco community in México.  The members of the bank will use their loans in the following ways:

Rosa will use her loan to buy chilies and tomatoes.
Ana María will buy shoes wholesale.
María Magdalena and Margarita will buy blouses, pants, and shirts.
María de Lourdes will buy jugs of water and soft drinks.

Ana María is 25 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has three children; six year old Miguel Ángel, four year old Wendy, and two year old José Mereció.  Ana María sells shoes.  She is requesting the loan to buy sandals, sneakers, boots, tennis shoes, and children’s shoes.  Part of the loan is for food.  

She started her business two years and a half years ago because she likes to sell.  Ever since she was a child she has worked in the footwear business.  Her husband brings her the shoes to sell as he works in a shoe shop. That is how she stocks her merchandise.  She sells her products door to door.  

Her business is important because if she gets something from there she takes it for food.  She is happy to meet more people, and it relaxes her.  She is happy about the loan that she will receive because she will buy shoes so that she has stock to sell to her customers.

Her dreams and hopes are that her children are well and lack for nothing.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Many thanks for the loans.  They continue to help our businesses grow, and they help our families.”

Anenecuilco is a beautiful village.  There are hills where sugar cane and corn are grown.  There is a house-museum where Emiliano Zapata was born.  There are documents, utensils that he used, photos, and a film about Emiliano Zapata.  His birthday is celebrated with a soiree at the elementary school.  There is music you can dance to, and there are singers.  At 11:00 p.m. they light torches and go to Zapata’s house to sing a birthday song with mariachis.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sneakers, boots, tennis shoes, and children’s shoes.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí es socia del banco comunal Las Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva recién 4 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y todo lo invierte en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su tienda de lubricantes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 baldes de aceite, 6 cámaras, 4 baterías, 6 llantas.
No es mucho el dinero que gana pero en algo le ayuda para comprar las cosas que le faltan; su esposo es empleado público y también le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Está contenta porque su negocio está mejorando cada día.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por las charlas que las promotoras dan a las socias, charlas como por ejemplo ¿cómo deben manejar sus negocios?.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the “Las Mujeres Del 2000” (The Women of 2000) Communal Bank in the Calleria district in the Ucayali department.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for four cycles.  She invests all of it in buying more merchandise to stock her lubricant store.  With her new loan for 2,000 soles she will buy three buckets of oil, six inner tubes, four batteries, and six tires.

She does not earn a lot of money, but it is something that helps her buy the things that she needs.  Her husband is a public employee, and he also helps her tend to her business.  She is happy because her business is improving every day.  

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the talks, like how you should manage your business, that are given to the members by the staff.

loans.use: to buy oil, inner tubes, and batteries.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
A la vivienda de señor José Luís le esta haciendo falta el techo en el patio trasero de la casa.
  Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que le esta haciendo falta como son varilla, lamina y pagarle a la persona que le ayudara a realizar la mejora. 
Don José Luís de dedica a la construcción de casas, con este ingreso pagara el crédito, ya que vive solo y sus hijos le ayudaran con los gastos que tiene el. 
Desea construir el techo y poner un taller de carpintería en ese lugar y así poder tener mas ingreso.
texts.en:
José Luís' property needs a roof over the back patio area.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy the material that he needs such as rods and sheets of metal, and also pay the person who will help him to carry out the improvement

José Luís's business is building houses.  He will repay his loan with this income since he lives alone and his children will help him with his expenses.  He would like to build the roof and set up a carpentry workshop in the space.  This will enable him to make more income.

loans.use: to build a roof

loans.name: Evelia Alvina

texts.es: Evelia tiene 37 años. Es una mujer muy responsable tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio como vendedora de ciertos productos como calzado y telas y al ver que obtenía suficiente ganancias con esta actividad decide seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatillas y telas. El sueño de ella es seguirle proporcionado mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelia is 37 years old.  She’s a very responsible woman; she has two children that depend on her.  Her economic activity is general merchandise sales.  She’s been in this business for over 12 years.  She started out selling certain footwear items and fabric and seeing that she earned good profits with this activity decided to continue doing it.  

She is asking for this loan to use as working capital to buy such things as sandals, athletic shoes, slippers and fabric.  Her dream is to continue doing home improvements.

loans.use: to buy sandals, athletic shoes, slippers and fabric.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La señora Felicia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, 
tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Cuenta con un pequeño negocio rodante (ambulatorio) de venta de bebidas, galletas y biscochos, donde sus principales clientes son los camioneros quienes descansan cuando llegan a la ciudad.  Dedica gran parte del día en la atención de su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 paquetes de agua mineral sin gas, 2 paquetes de agua mineral con gas, 4 paquetes de gaseosa inca cola, 2 paquetes de coca cola, 2 paquetes de guaraná, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 bolsas de biscocho, 2 paquetes de frugos,3 paquetes de bolsa , 1 paquete de sorbete, 1 ciento de vasos descartables.
Con estos productos abastecerá nuevamente su negocio, debido a la situación actual del país las cosas han subido de precio y los negocios han caído en sus ventas, pero Felicita continúa con su trabajo con la esperanza de crecer cada día más. 
Con Manuela Ramos ve la oportunidad de poder seguir trabajando y no dejar caer su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicia is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children.

She has a small rolling (ambulatory) business selling beverages, cookies and cakes where her main customers are truck drivers seeking a bit of respite when they arrive in the city.  She spends a large part of the day tending to her business.

She will use the new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy: 5 packets of flat mineral water, 2 packets of sparkling mineral water, 4 packets of Inca Cola, 2 packets of Coca-Cola, 2 packets of Guaraná (soft drink), 2 boxes of cookies, 2 bags of cake, 2 packets of Frugos (fruit juice), 3 packages of bags, 1 packet of drinking straws and 100 disposable drinking glasses.

She will stock her business again with these products.  Because of the current situation in the country, prices have risen and sales have dropped in businesses but Felicia continues working in hopes of growing more each day.  With Manuela Ramos she sees the opportunity to continue working and keeping her business from failing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, mineral water and juices.

loans.name: Sofia Suyapa

texts.en: Sofia lives in the town of Danli and runs a small business selling new clothing and footwear. Over the last three years of running this business, Sofia has built up a loyal clientele based on her selection of clothing, competitive prices and good customer service. She is requesting a loan of 12,500 lempiras with which to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, undergarments and shoes.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cayo de 53 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Erick de 17 y Brian de 16 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días Nelly se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana comienza con sus ventas diarias, ya que la gente que vive por su barrio sale a trabajar muy temprano. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, lo cual ha hecho que tenga más clientes que la competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse tan temprano y no dedicarle mucho tiempo a sus hijos. Este será el décimo primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que lleguen en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Nelly, 40, is a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Cayo, 53, and their two beloved sons:  Erick, 17 and Brian 16 who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

Nelly rises very early every day to open her grocery store.  Around 6am she starts her daily sales because the people who live in her neighborhood start out for work very early.  She is a very cheerful and persuasive seller which has led to her having more customers than the competition.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She’s been in this business for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to get up early and not having much time to spend with her children.

This is the 11th loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her installment payments and is always watchful of the agreements reached in her group.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes  es conviviente, tiene 4  hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres D. Sol” grupo  conformado por 14 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Mercedes  trabaja desD. hace 7  años en la venta y fabricación D. D. filtros D. aspiradora es decir fabrica las bolsas que contienen las aspiradoras   este trabajo surge a raíz D. que   a su esposo lo despidieron D. su trabajo y tenían que mantener a sus 4 hijos es así que mercedes entro a  trabajar a una fabrica y ahí aprendió a fabricar bolsas para aspiradora, y como ella es una mujer  emprendedora inicio su propio negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos economicos sus hijos cuentan con educación y se ha comprado artefactos eléctricos, muebles etc. Su sueño D. Mercedes es vender a otros países y que su negocio siga creciendo, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería para la fabricacionD. bolsas D. aspiradoras. Sabemos que Mercedes  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Mercedes has a spouse and four school aged children.  She is currently a member of the “Mujeres D. Sol” communal bank which has 14 members dedicated to various commercial activities.

Mercedes has worked for the last 7 years selling and manufacturing vacuum cleaner filters, that is to say, she makes the bags that vacuum cleaners have.  This work arose because her husband was laid off from work and they had to support their four children.  This led Mercedes to start working in a factory and that’s where she learned how to make vacuum cleaner bags.  Because she’s an enterprising woman, she started her own business and thanks to her effort and dedication has attained better income, her children are educated and she’s been able to buy appliances, furniture, etc.

Mercedes’ dream is to sell in other countries and that the business continues to grow.  In order to continue growing, Mercedes has requested a new loan to buy raw materials to manufacture vacuum cleaner bags.  We know that Mercedes will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture vacuum cleaner bags.

loans.name: Diana Roxana

texts.es:
La señorita Roxana (así la llaman), es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, ers soltera y tiene 23 años de edad.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a brndar servicio de taxi, cuenta con un motocarro que le genera un ingreso diario.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles invertirá S/. 100 para el pago de tapizado de los asientos, comprará 3 llantas,  3 cámaras, 1  litro de aceite y 1 paquete de cera.
Es una señorita muy activa y preocupada por su futuro, está trabajando ahora para poder comprar sus cosas y tener ciertas comodidades más adelante.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos otorgados a su persona ha podido mantener su negocio, sobre todo porque en la zona donde vive hay mucha competencia.  
Conlos ingresos de su negoico puede también ayudar a su mama y a sus hermanos que todavía estudian.
texts.en:
Miss Roxana (that’s what she’s called) is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 23 years old and single.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She provides taxi services.  She has a motorcar that produces daily income.  She will use the new 1500 new sol loan thus:  100 soles to have the seats reupholstered, she will buy three tires and three inner tubes, 1 liter of oil and 1 package of wax.

She is a very active young woman who is concerned about her future.  She is working now to be able to buy her things and to have a few comforts later on.

Thanks to the Manuela Ramos loans she’s gotten she’s been able to stay in business especially because in the area where she lives there is a lot of competition.  She can use income from the business also to help her out mother and siblings who are still in school.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes.

loans.name: Angela Milagros

texts.es: La señora Ángela es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad ambos están en edad escolar, angela tiene una pequeña bodega de golosinas y productos de primera necesidad, como arroz azúcar aceite entre otros ,en sus inicios su bodega era pequeña y ahora esta un poco mas surtida, angela eligió este tipo de trabajo para estar cerca de su familia, ya tiene 1 año laborando en esta actividad , el dinero del prestamos será invertido en ampliar su negocio comprando productos como gaseosas, golosinas, arroz, fideos, aceite, azúcar, entre otras cosas, el sueño a futuro de la señora angela es agrandar mucho mas su negocio para que con ello le genere mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida, angela esta muy contenta con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Ángela is a single mother of two children who are 14 and 7 years of age and still school aged.  Ángela has a small store selling snacks and basic need items like rice, sugar and oil, among others.  At the beginning the store was very small but now it’s better stocked.  Ángela chose this way of life to be near her family.  She’s been in business a year.  

The money from the loans will be invested to expand her business buying such products as soft drinks, snacks, rice, noodles, oil and sugar, among others.  Ángela’s dream for the future is to enlarge the business even more so that it will generate better income and thus improve her quality of life.  Ángela is very happy with the trust that’s been placed in her.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. La venta de carne le ha dado a Rocío los ingresos necesarios par mantener a su familia, ella tiene su puesto en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que la carne que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa, lo cual le ha hecho una buena fama y le trae mucho clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre la carne que más sabor le dará a sus comidas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo es muy agotador y muy sacrificado este trabajo, pero debe hacerlo si desea ganar dinero. Espera con el tiempo tener una carnicería más grande en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Por otro lado desea pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne, ya que últimamente la demanda ha crecido.
texts.en:
Rocío, 40, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house and what she most wants is to work hard to stand out in life.  Selling meat has given Rocío the necessary income to support her family.  She has a stand in Market #2 (an important market in the city of Pucallpa) which is very popular because the meat she sells is very fresh and delicious and this has created a good reputation that attracts many customers.

What she enjoys the most about her work is advising customers about which meats will most enhance the flavor of their meals.  She’s been in business 20 years.  Although it is very exhausting and demanding, she has to do it if she wants to earn money.  She hopes in time to have a larger butcher shop where she can provide better customer service.

This will be her third loan with MFP so she’s hoping to have all of your support.  On the other hand, she wants to make her installment payments on time.  She is a very active and supportive member of her communal bank which makes her very respected by the other members.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more meat since demand has increased recently.

loans.use: to buy more meat to stock her business.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
Salir adelante con su negocio y apoyar financieramente a su esposo debido a los problemas de salud que él actualmente enfrenta, es el sueño de María Leonor, quien a sus 58 años de edad tiene la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida. Las confecciones son un oficio al que se ha dedicado desde hace algunos años y desde su casa elabora prendas de vestir a la medida, toallas y tendidos que vende a sus clientes fijos. 
 
María necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, botones, entre otros insumos que le permitan mantener existencia de sus productos para mostrarlos a sus clientes y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
To get ahead with her business and to financially support her husband because of health problems he’s currently facing is María Leonor’s dream.  At the age of 58 she has the hope of improving her quality of life.  

For some years she’s been sewing and makes clothes to order, towels and bedclothes that she sells to regular customers.  

María needs a loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons, among other supplies that will make it possible for her to have products on hand to show her customers and thus earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Balbina

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of Danli where she sells freshly prepared bread for a living. She has many regular customers and sells mainly to local businesses. Maria also takes in seamstress work on the side to earn additional income. Between these two businesses, she has been able to raise her family and send her children to school. Maria is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras with which to buy bulk quantities of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, butter and margarine.

loans.name: Maximiliana Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera.
Son 2 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de bebidas gaseosas y jugos en un grifo de la zona, su negocio es algo pesado porque vende también en horas de la noche y parte del día, tiene muy poco tiempo para poder pasar con sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 paquete de gaseosas, 2 paquetes de agua sin gas, 3 cajas de néctar, 2 paquetes de pepsicola, 4 paquetes de cola real.
No es mucha la inversión, pero para poder atender a su clientela debe tener siempre bien surtidos sus productos.
Quizá más adelante pondrá un negocio que le permita estar más cerca a sus hijos.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a las mujeres trabajadoras que mucho lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 46 years old and a single mother.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.  She is a street vendor selling soft drinks and fruit juices served from large jugs.  Her work is demanding because she sells during some of the nighttime hours and part of the day and she has very little time left to spend wither children.

She will use the new 1200 new sol loan to buy:  1 packet of soft drinks, 2 packets of still water, 3 boxes of nectar, 2 packets of Pepsi-Cola and 4 packets of Kola Real.  It isn’t a very large investment but, in order to meet customer demand, she always has to be well stocked.  Perhaps later on she’ll open a business that will allow her to be nearer her children.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting working women who very much need it.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and frui nectars.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Paulina tiene 37 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de granos secos, la socia compra al por mayor maíz, de diferentes variedades y los vende en su stand en el mercado del poblado de Ocongate; la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos al por mayor y de este modo incrementar sus ventas, la socia comprara maíz de diferentes variedades, ella tiene un cliente que le compra para tomar como semillas los granos y sembrar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Paulina, 37, is a member of the “Señor de Tayancani” communal bank.  She lives in Ocongate District in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has six children.  She alternates her daily chores with being a dry grain merchant.  She buys various strains of corn at wholesale and then sells it in her stand in the town of Ocongate’s market.  She needs a loan to buy grain at wholesale in order to increase sales.  She will buy corn of various strains; she has a customer that buys the grains to use as seeds to plant.  She is requests the loan to buy corn.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan because it allows her to grow with her business and to improve her quality of life.  Similarly, she commits to pay her installments according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana forma parte del banco comunal “Mi banco Mi amigo 2” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, trabaja junto a su marido y venden diferentes artículos de temporada, sobre todo aquellos que se puedan vender rápido y a bajo costo. Viviana instala su puesto en una feria persa libre los días jueves, sábados, domingos y festivos de 8ºº a 15ºº horas. Viviana comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que las temporadas altas de venta son los días 15 y 30 de cada mes, sin embargo el resto de los días también le va bien. 
Con el crédito comprará pantalón de buzos polares y parlantes de automóvil.
Gracias a su negocio Viviana ha podido concretar algunos de sus sueños como cancelar el total de su casa propia, pagar sus estudios de Técnico en químico farmacéutico y ser el sustento económico de su hogar.
Sus metas son comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería. 
Viviana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 27 y 23 años de edad, ambos trabajan, pero le ayudan en su negocio los fines de semana, de ésta manera la familia se ha unido más en sus relaciones. Uno de sus hijos está casado, por lo tanto también vive junto a su nuera y sus dos nietos de 7 años y 6 meses de edad. Sus motivaciones y sueños son continuar con su negocio, para que le permita seguir concretando sus proyectos. 
Viviana está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de contar con un capital para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a la relación con las socias del grupo del banco comunal, ésta ha sido muy buena, ya que existe confianza y solidaridad entre ellas. También considera que es muy importante aprender e incorporar nuevos conocimientos a su propio negocio. En general Viviana se encuentra muy contenta por sus logros.
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Mi Banco Mi Amigo 2” (My Bank My Friend 2) which belongs to Pudahuel Commune, city of Santiago.

She has been a merchant for the last 15 years.  She works alongside her husband selling various seasonal items, especially those they can sell quickly and at low prices.

Viviana sets up her stand in a bazaar on Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays from 8am to 3pm.  Viviana comments that she’s done very well in business and that the days with the best sales are the 15th and 30th of each month; however, she does well the rest of the days too.  She will use the loan to buy sweatpants and car speakers.

Thanks to the business Viviana has been able to make some of her dreams a reality like, paying off her house, paying for her Pharmacy Technician training and supporting her home’s economy.  Her goal is to buy a pickup truck to transport her merchandise.

Viviana lives with her husband and two children who are 27 and 23 years of age and who both work but who help her with her business on weekends.  This has led to more family togetherness.

One of her sons is married so her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are 7 and 6 years of age also live with her.  Her motivation and dreams are to continue in business so that she can continue to carry out her projects.

Viviana is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza because it’s given her the opportunity to have investment capital for her business.  With respect to the relationship with the other communal bank group members, it has been very good because trust and mutual support exists among them.  She also considers that it’s very important to learn new things to apply to her own business.  In general, Viviana is very happy about her accomplishments.

Pudahuel is a commune in western Santiago (capital of Chile) Metropolitan District.  The word comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche language) that means “place where the waters come together” or “place of puddles” because it has a varied network of streams composed of the Mapocho River and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces creeks which make the soil favorable for farming due to the abundant subterranean water.

loans.use: to buy sweat pants and car speakers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta y reparación de artículos electrónico, le esta haciendo falta herramienta mas moderna y comprar mas aparatos como son televisiones, radios, computadoras y  artículos de cocinas eléctricos. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener más inventario para tener mas ingreso. Con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta y la reparación de los aparatos eléctricos pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan has already had two loans with KIVA which he paid off on time. He is asking for a loan to invest in his business selling and repairing electronics. He needs some more modern tools and to buy items such as televisions, radios, computers and kitchen appliances.  
 
He wants to improve his business and have more inventory to have more income. With the earnings he makes from selling and repairing electronics, he will pay off the loan.

loans.use: to invest in his business

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
La señora Danilza es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del Distrito Calleria Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva 5 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega, que hace pocos meses  abrió y funciona en su misma casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 soles comprara: 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 1 paquete D. fideos tallarín, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. mermelada en sache, 1 caja D. mayonesa, 1  docena D. jabón en barra, 1 docena D. jaboncillo, ½ saco D. azúcar, ½ saco D. arroz, 1 paquete D. harina, 1 caja D. mantequilla.
Más adelante hará otro préstamo D. mayor monto, cuando se sienta capaz D. poder pagarlo sin ningún problema.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos podrá tener un negocio propio y más adelante no depender D. nadie más que D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
Danilza is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias [Supportive Women] community bank of the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 59 years old. She is married and has one son.  She has worked for 5 years with loans from Manuela Ramos. She has a small store which she opened a few months ago from her own home.  

With this new loan of S/. 1,500.00 soles, she will buy: 3 packages of toilet paper, 1 package of noodles, 1 box of oil, 1 box of milk, 1 box of jam in bags, 1 box of mayonnaise, 1 dozen packs of soap, 1/2 sack of sugar, 1/2 sack of rice, 1 package of flour, 1 box of butter.  

In the future, she will take out a larger loan when she feels abot to pay it off with any trouble. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she will be able to have her own business and in the future not have to depend on anyone for work.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, pasta, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 43 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfonso de 41 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Kassia de 11 y Kamila de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Sonia el negocio de la venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostenerse por si sola, ella a sus 18 años decidió salir de la casa de sus padres y ser independiente; hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas en su barrio, ya que las prendas que vende son muy novedosas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas, y tener variedad de mercadería; lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo, espera con el tiempo tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene para vender.
texts.en:
Sonia, 43, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Alfonso, 41, and their two beloved children, Kassia, 11, and Kamila, 8, that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  For Sonia, selling clothes has been an activity that has helped her obtain income needed to support herself on her own.  At the age of 18 she decided to leave her parents’ house and be independent.  Today, she’s one of her neighborhood’s most sought after clothes vendors because the items of clothing she sells are very original.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her neighbors and having a wide variety of merchandise.  She’s been in this line of work for six years and considers the most difficult part of it having to walk all day seeking customers.  Even though, she knows that that’s her work and she has to do it.  She hopes in time to have a larger store where she can sell her merchandise more comfortably.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP so she hopes to have all of your support.  She is a very cheerful, responsible member of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 2500 new sol loan to buy more clothes to increase the amount of merchandise she has available to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.en:
Juan is 64 years old and lives near the city of San Gabriel, Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 20 and 12. He describes himself as a happy and calm person who likes to share his free time with his family. For his business, he grows potatoes and carrots. He began working in agriculture when he was very young. Juan purchased his farmland, where he works with his older children that are married and no longer live with him. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate potatoes because he is experiencing difficulty with the few rains that have fallen. 

Juan has been getting loans from FODEMI for three years. He says that his past loans have changed his family for the better and he has been able to grow his farming business. His goals are to eventually buy a larger field, support his children, and enlarge his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate potatoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
La señora Libertad es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.
Los años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos le han servido para poner su negocio, ella birnda el servicio de copias y venta de algunos artículos de librería. Ha trabajado bastante para poder tener este negocio, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 millares de papel bon, 2 cajas de lapiceros, 1 caja de plumón indeleble, 1 caja de clips, 1 caja de cinta Scott, 1 caja de tiza, 1 ciento de folder de manila, 1 ciento de fas tener, 1 caja de borradores, 1 caja de regla chica.
Con  este préstamo implementará un poco más su negocio. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por facilitarle los préstamos que le permiten continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libertad is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women) in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 65 years old and is married.

The years she’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans have served to set up her business.  She provides copying services and sells a few stationery items.  She’s worked quite a bit to be able to have this business; one of her children helps her with it.

She will use the new loan of 3000 new soles to buy:  6 reams of bond paper, 2 boxes of mechanical pencils, 1 box of indelible marker, 1 box of paper clips, 1 box of Scotch tape, 1 box of chalk, 100 Manila folders, 100 fasteners, 1 box of erasers and one box of small rulers.

She will stock her business a bit more with this loan.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing the loans that allow her to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy paper, school supplies and office supplies.

loans.name: María Emilce

texts.es:
La venta de mercancía es el negocio al que se dedica María Emilce, quien desde su casa vende no sólo mercancía que ella adquiere en el centro de Medellín sino también productos por catálogo, pues como ella misma lo afirma, detrás de una venta se hace la otra. Lo de comerciante lo lleva en la sangre, pues desde pequeña aprendió al lado de su familia este oficio. María trabaja todos los días pues su propósito además de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es ayudar a cubrir los gastos del hogar y en ocasiones cuando su esposo se ha visto desempleado responder por las obligaciones económicas, esta emprendedora ahorra juiciosamente con el propósito de brindarle una buena educación a su hija de 14 años. 
 
María necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de mercancía, puesto que en la medida en que compre más el descuento será mayor y sus ganancias se incrementarán.
texts.en:
Selling merchandise is María Emilce’s line of work.  She sells from home not only merchandise she gets in downtown Medellín but also catalogue items because, as she herself states, one sale is piggy-backed on the other.

Being a merchant runs in her blood because she learned this occupation alongside her family while still a little girl.  María works every day because her goal, besides improving her and her family’s quality of life, is to help cover household expenses and sometimes, when her husband has been unemployed, to meet their economic obligations.  This entrepreneur is judiciously saving in order to provide her 14-year-old daughter with a good education.

María needs a loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise because the more she buys the larger the discount she gets and her profits will thus increase.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnulfo de 54 años y su querida nieta Angi de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Edith toda su vida ha trabajado mucho por salir adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda donde vende de todo, la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy alegre y siempre los atiende muy bien. A ella le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes, lleva 9 años en este negocio y anhela que su tienda se convierta en la principal de su barrio, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda y soportar el calor que hace ahí, ya que su trabajo le exige quedarse tiempo completo y no tiene tiempo para dedicarle a su familia o salir a distraerse un rato. Pero su fin es salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ella es nueva en su banco comunal y ha sido bien recibida por el resto de las socias, por lo cual se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para mejorar el stock  de su tienda.
texts.en:
Edith, 54, is a very friendly and straightforward woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Arnulfo, 54, and her dear granddaughter Angi, 8, on whom she wishes to bestow a better future. Edith has worked long hours all her life to get ahead. Currently she has a shop where she sells a bit of everything, and which is frequently shopped by her customers, since she is very cheerful and always very attentive to their needs. She really enjoys conversing with her customers. She has had this business for nine years and would like her store to become the main shop in her neighborhood, but she knows she must work hard in order to achieve that. What she likes the least is having to stay indoors all day and tolerate the heat inside the store, since her work demands that she remain there full time and she does not have time to devote to her family or to go out and amuse herself for a bit. However, her goal is to get ahead and have a better future.
