For this reason she focuses on work and tries to give the best of herself for its success.  She sells cleaning products such as disinfectants and detergent, she provides friendly customer service selling in the same area where she lives.  She has a lot of clients and neighbors that know her and trust her with her products.  To her the most important thing is to see her family in better conditions and she knows the only way to achieve it is through daily hard work, this is why she has decided to expand her business and needs a loan to do it because her own financial resources are not sufficient,  she requests a loan to "integral" to buy a variety of disinfectant and detergent products to supply a higher demand.  This way she hopes to achieve her dream and give her kids what they deserve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of disinfectants and detergents to supply a growing demand for products in her business.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 7  hijos, 4 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y tres de 17, 15 y 10 años, los cuatro mayores  estudian en Universidad y los tres menores en  colegio y escuela, cinco de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de salud.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas y hasta donde llegan sus clientes,  nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todos los fines de semana,  deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cada vez que  necesita. Tiene seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Colorado Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial heritage and its crafts, recognized nationally and internationally.  The place for the famous palmetto straw hats.

María is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because interests are lower than in other credit institutions.  She is 46 years old, has a partner, and from the relationship has 7 children, 4 of whom are grown, and three being 17, 15, and 10 years old.  The four older children are university students, and the three younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Five of her children still live with her.  Her spouse does not work, for health reasons.

She sells all types of clothing, door to door, and also sells from her home, where she has display windows and where customers come.  She tells us that she also accepts orders.  She works three days a week, and every weekend, leaving items on credit, and collecting every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for six years, and things are going well for her.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as:  pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  

Her wishes are to be healthy and to continue working.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace  12 años desde que se  formo y le gusta porque son muy responsables sus compañeras del banco. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Manta.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace muchos años donde cose todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller, elabora todo tipo de prendas tanto para damas y caballeros pero lo que más le gusta confeccionar es la ropa para damas ya que allí hay mas diseños. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura.

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Colorado community bank meets in Colorado, in Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Nancy is a founding member of the community bank which was established 12 years ago.  She enjoys belonging to the bank because her fellow members are all very responsible people.  Nancy is 47 years old, married, and has two grown-up children who still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.  Several years ago, Nancy learned dressmaking skills in an academy in the city of Manta.

Nancy has a small sewing workshop, which she has owned for many years now, where she sews all kinds of clothes.  She works on orders from individuals who come to her workshop.  She makes all kinds of men's and women's clothes but what she likes making most of all are women's clothes because there are more designs.  Nancy works every day of the week from 6.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes even later still when she has orders to deliver.  She tells us that she has been in this business for more than 20 years and it has done very well.

Nancy will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies.

Nancy's dreams are to own a larger workshop and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Nyamaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her two children, age 17 and 19, both attend local secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter who makes many kinds of household goods such as beds, tables, and chairs, etc. 

Nyamaa manages a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2008 after moving to center of the province. Previously, she was a herder with some husbandry animals. However, because of bad winter weather, she lost all her husbandry animals. So she decided to conduct her clothing trading business. Now she has many regular customers and imports her goods from China. She is planning to rent a booth where the sales are quite high. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to expand my business in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. All her children are grown up and live separately. She manages a food cafe, with the help of her husband, in her town. She started her business in 2001 and has been able to build a strong customer base. Her food cafe is located along the main road of her province. Therefore she has many regular customers and her business is quite profitable. She attributes her business success to the good location of her food cafe. 

Now, Narantsetseg's working capital exceeds 1,800,000 MNT. She is one of the experienced and knowledgeable businesswomen, who is planning to expand her food cafe. She is a polite woman who says, "All I want is to have big building for my business." She is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT loan to purchase meat, milk and grocery items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, milk and grocery items.

loans.name: Leticia Elizabeth

texts.es: Leticia Elizabeth de 33 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su madre de 67 años y sus dos pequeñas hijas las cuales ya se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Leticia posee un puesto en la zona central donde reside en el cual  vende ricas e higiénicas tortillas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas razón por la cual ya es muy conocida en la zona y los clientes la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio y sobre todo higiene y  buenos precios en sus tortillas. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora cada día se pregunta cómo puede mejorar sus ingresos para poder dar  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Ha decidido  ampliar su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes no solo tortillas sino también bebidas como agua y jugos, de esta manera quiere a traer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos. Esto le dio la idea de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de bebidas e invertir en el mantenimiento de la venta de tortillas. Tiene mucha Fe que tendrá éxito con la decisión tomada y sus condiciones de vida poco a poco se irán trasformando de manera positiva.
texts.en:
Leticia Elizabeth is 33 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her 67 year-old mother and her two young daughters who are in their first years of school.

Leticia owns a stall in the central zone where she lives.  She sells delicious and hygienically-prepared tortillas.  She has been selling tortillas for many years and so she is very well known in the area.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she provides a good service, prepares her tortillas hygienically and sells them at a good price.

Leticia is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman.  Every day she asks herself how she can improve her income so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  She has decided to expand her business and start offering her customers not only tortillas but also drinks such as water and juice.  In this way, she hopes to attract more customers which will enable her to improve her income.  She had the idea of requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she could buy a variety of drinks and invest in her tortilla business.  Leticia has a lot of faith that the decision she has taken will prove successful and that her living conditions will gradually change for the better.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and invest in her tortilla business

loans.name: Dolores América

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 50 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tuvo dos hijos, mayores de edad y que  aun vive con ella ya que están solteros.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para que  nunca les falte nada decidió dedicarse al comercio, ella sale todos los fines de semana  desde la madrugada a la ciudad de Manta a comprar el mejor pescado para luego en su carro ir por toda la ciudad vendiendo este producto, también vende queso y pollo por libras. Realiza esta actividad comercial por 20 años y gracias a esto ella ha podido darles todo a sus hijos desde la alimentación hasta sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, queso y pollos para la venta. Ella está en el banco comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que otorga la institución a sus clientes. 

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The 'Colorado' Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado, Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisan crafts. It is recognized at the national and international level. Here they make the famous [Panama] hats of 'toquilla' straw.

In Colorado we meet Dolores, 50 years of age, who is separated, but from her relationship there were 2 children, now grown, who still live with her because they are single.

Dolores, a woman who is very determined to forge ahead with her children and to see that they never lack anything, decided to become a merchant.  She goes out each weekend, starting early in the morning, to the city of Manta to buy the best fish. Then she drives throughout the city selling her fish, and cheese and chicken by the pound. She has pursued this commercial activity for more than 20 years and thanks to her efforts, Dolores has provided for her children, from their food to their school bills. 

This loan is to buy fish, cheese, and chicken to sell. Dolores has belonged to her communal bank from its launch, and she likes it for the benefits the institution offers its clients. 

Dolores' dream is to buy another car, since the one she has is somewhat deteriorated.

loans.use: buy fish, cheese, and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older two children, whom are 12 and 14 years old, go to a local secondary school while the younger two are in kindergarten. His wife is a salesperson in a private little store. 

Naranbaatar manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business after moving to the center of the province. Since then, his business has been quite successful. This has allowed him to buy a plot of land in order to build a house. He is planning to repair his car in order to provide safe and reliable drives for his customers. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am trying hard to feed my family. Previously I used to spend all of my earning for my family consumption. Now my wife has a job. So we can save money for the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials that she needs such as rice, beans, corn, meat, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Deice Mireya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorad se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Deice es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y uno de 16 años, dos de sus hijos estudian la mayor en universidad y el menor en colegio todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer tiene un bus.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también le mandan desde Colombia. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y nos cuenta que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos se realicen como profesionales.
texts.en:
The “De Colorado” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous “Panama” hats.

Deice is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rate is lower than in other credit institutions.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children, two adults and a 16-year-old.  Two of her children are studying.  Her older daughter is in the university and the youngest is in high school.  All her children still live with her.  Her husband’s a driver and has a bus.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells from home where her customers come to buy.  She tells us that most of her sales are order based.  She works every day mostly in the morning.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise and she also has items sent to her from Colombia.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and she tells us that she started it with the first loan she got from the institution.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Berta Rosalva

texts.es: Berta Rosalva de 38 años de edad, reside con su hijo e hija en su casa. Los dos hijos de Berta se encuentran estudiando y tienen la esperanza que algún día lograrán ser grandes profesionales y podrán ayudar a su querida madre que con gran esfuerzo  les ayuda a continuar sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de minutas en los lugares más concurridos en la zona donde reside. Gracias a Dios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes ya que se caracteriza por ser amable y por siempre tener ricas e higiénicas minutas  y sobre todo con buenos precios. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones y con mejores oportunidades a las que ella tuvo. Esto la ha impulsado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria para seguir manteniendo su negocio activo. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de jarabes, sal, limones, hielo, etc. De esta manera espera mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta Rosalva, 38, lives with her son and daughter in her house.  Berta’s two children are in school and they hope someday to become great professionals to help their beloved mother who has worked so hard to help them continue with their schooling.

She sells flavored ice drinks in the most popular areas where she lives.  Thanks to God she has managed to win over the trust of many customers since she is noted for her kindness and because she always has delicious, hygienic drinks at, above all, good prices.  Her dream is to see her children in better conditions and with better opportunities than she had.  

This has impelled her to make the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy raw materials needed to keep her business going.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of syrups, salt, lemons, ice, etc.  She hopes thus to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of syrups, salt, lemons, ice. etc.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughters, who haven't reached school age, stay home. With the help of her husband, she manages a clothes and grocery-product trading business between Ulaanbaatar city and her sum (a subdivision of a province). She sells all kinds of grocery items and a variety of clothes for all ages. She started her business in 2005 and is planning to expand her business in the future. She collects orders from her customers and her husband transports the ordered products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They purchase their products four or five times a month from Ulaanbaatar city. With their business earnings, they bought a car and a plot of land where they live now. She is a polite and open-minded woman who says, "I am planning to conduct my business in the center of province." She is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more grocery products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor de María de 23 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida de 22 años y con su pequeña hija en casa familiar.  Flor se dedica a la venta de pan, desde hace 7 años que posee una pequeña panadería en la cual trabaja junto con su compañero de vida. Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana Flor empieza el día y lo primero que hace es el rico pan que más tarde pone a la venta.  Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad se ha ganado la confianza de los vecinos y estos están satisfechos tanto con el servicio como con el rico pan que Flor ofrece. Últimamente ha notado que la cantidad de pan que hace no le alcanza para cubrir toda la demanda. Ya que es una mujer emprendedora no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad y ha decidido aumentar la producción para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo, es por esta razón que se decidió en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar una cantidad mayor de material como harina, azúcar, aceite y de mas materiales necesarios para llevar acabo la producción del delicioso pan. Le pide a Dios que esta decisión le ayude a mejor su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 23 years old.  She lives with her 22 year old life partner and their little daughter in the family home.  Flor sells bread, and she has had a small bakery for seven years.  She works there with her life partner.  Flor starts in the very early hours of the morning.  The first thing she does is make the delicious bread that she will later sell.

Thanks to her charisma and kindness, she has won her neighbors' confidence.  They are satisfied with the service as much as with the delicious bread that Flor sells.  She has noticed that lately the quantity of bread that she makes does not cover all of the demand.

As an enterprising woman she does not want to let this opportunity pass.  She has decided to increase her production.  To do so she needs the help of a loan.  That is the reason she decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan is to buy a greater quantity of ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make her delicious bread.  She asks God that this decision will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make her delicious bread.

loans.name: Bayanbat

texts.en:
Bayanbat, 41, lives with his wife and 11-year-old-daughter, a secondary school student, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia.

With the help of his wife, Bayanbat manages a coal and wood-trading business which he started in his town in 2003. Since then their business has stabilized, allowing them to rent a stall at a local market and buy a truck for their transportation service business in 2008. Bayanbat transports large amounts of coal during winter seasons and construction materials during summer seasons. He also bought a trailer with his earnings in order to carry more coal or construction material, thereby increasing his business profit.

Bayanbat is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business and some auto parts for his truck. A polite and responsible businessman, he says, "I am planning to expand my business in order to better my life."

loans.use: to purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 42 years old and married with four children.

Lorelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell at her store.

Lorelie has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from food vending and E-loading.

Lorelie aspires to earn and save money to build a food stall for her barbecue business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad y aún viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja pues sufrió un accidente.

Ella para poder sacar a su familia adelante hace tiempo instalo un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, bocadillos y otras golosinas, nos cuenta que este negocio lo puso para aprovechar que su casa está frente a un colegio y por lo general a los chicos les gusta todos estos productos, por lo cual las ventas están aseguradas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00. Nos cuenta  que gracias a los créditos que recibió de la institución ella pudo financiar este pequeño negocio que le ayuda mucho para su sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar dulces, golosinas, helados, colas, entre otras cosas que también vende. Está en el banco comunal hace dos años y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
The “De Colorado” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous “Panama” hats.

We met Carmen, 53, here.  She is married and has six adult children who still live with her.  Her husband no longer works because he suffered an accident.

In order to move her family forward she set up a small snack bar at home some time ago where she sells ice cream, colas, fast food and other snacks.  She tells us that she set up this business in order to take advantage of the fact that her house is across the street from a school and the youngsters generally like all these products so her sales are a sure thing.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm.  She tells us that thanks to the loans she was able to get from the institution she was able to finance this small business which helps her a lot for her daily sustenance.

She will use this loan to buy candy, snacks, ice cream and colas, among other things that she also sells.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the help and support that the bank gives her.  Her dream is to have another business.

loans.use: to buy candy, snacks, ice cream, colas, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Merlyn is a farmer in the Philippines. She grows vegetables to help her family. She plants vegetables like eggplant, string beans, tomatoes and bell peppers. Merlyn follows the excellent method of vegetable cultivation by planting vegetables in beds.

She earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every month in this cultivation. She has been doing this for two years. Merlyn requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay for the labor cost of soil preparation. 

Merlyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Merlyn hopes that she can distribute vegetables in the market nationwide.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of soil preparation.

loans.name: Holaya Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Holaya, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es  mayor de edad y está comprometido,  aun vive con ella junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Su esposo es agricultor pero ya no labora por la edad.

Ella es la encargada del bar de una escuela de la localidad, allí vende todo tipo de productos que prepara en su casa y de fabrica, ella prepara y vende corviches, empanadas, jugos de frutas, además de golosinas, sodas, gelatinas entre otras cosas, trabaja de lunes a viernes, realiza esta actividad por diez años y esto le ha ayudado mucho para los gastos de su  familia ahora que su esposo no trabaja.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, gelatinas, papas fritas e ingredientes necesarios para preparar los bocadillos. Lleva seis años en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido poco a poco aumentar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'Colorado' Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado, Montecristi canton. Colorado is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts, recognized at the national and international level.  The town is famous for its [Panama] hats made of 'toquilla' straw.

Here we meet Holaya, 62 years old, married and with a son who is grown and engaged, but still lives with her and her husband and with his little son. Holaya's husband is an agricultural worker but he no longer works, due to age.

Holaya is in charge of a bar, located in a school in her locality. Here she sells all types of products she prepares at home and also manufactured products. She prepares and sells, ceviches, stuffed buns, fruit juices, plus sweets, sodas, and gelatins, among other things. Holaya works from Monday through Friday. She has been doing this for 10 years and it has greatly helped with family expenses, now that her husband no longer works.

This loan is to buy sodas, gelatins, fried potatoes, and the ingredients necessary for preparing sandwiches. Holaya has been a member of her communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because with the loans, she has been able to, little by litlte, augment her business.

Her dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: buy sodas, gelatins, fried potatoes, and ingredients for preparing sandwiches.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 59 years old and widowed with ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Lydia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns income from selling fruits and vegetables. Lydia hopes to save enough money so she can rent a space in a public market and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Marfelina

texts.en: Marfelina, a 41-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising and selling livestock such as goats and cows to earn a living for the past two years. A member of PMPC for eight years, Marfelina is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Nenita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 32-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where for the past three years she has operated a mini grocery shop that sells canned goods, food in pouches, food ingredients, school supplies, and refreshments. She earns a monthly income of PHP 6,000.00.

A new member of GDMPC, Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase store stock to sell. She hopes to someday have a large grocery shop in their town.

loans.use: to purchase store stock to sell.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Sam On, 53 years old, has been a primary teacher for about 10 years with $3 per day for the income. His wife stays home taking care of the children. They have five children, 25, 20, 18, 13, and 7 years old. Two of her children are studying and the other three are working in Thailand. All of them get $13 per day for their income. Because his son and daughter are staying in Thailand, he is in charge of taking good care of their children for everything. 
There are eight members in his household including his four grandsons. 

Every month, he has to spend $55 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $20 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy columns and wood to repair his house. He will keep his career as a teacher until he retires because he loves this career.

loans.use: To buy columns and wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Feliciana is 46 years old and has three children who are in school. Feliciana has a ready-to-wear (RTW) business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase blouses, T-shirts, pants, etc., to sell. Feliciana has been in this business for three years. In the future, Feliciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, T-shirts, pants, etc., to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is 49 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. Candelaria runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. Candelaria has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for five years and also earns income from selling vegetables. Candelaria hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and married with seven children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items like sugar, soap, etc. to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and earns additional income from a boarding house.

Juliet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Nenita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Cherry has been in this business for 25 years. Cherry earns more income from frozen foods.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family. Mely is married and has a shoe sales business in the Philippines.

Mely requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of shoes and RTW to sell.

Mely has been in this business for 37 years now and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear (clothing).

In the future, Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and RTW to sell

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is 58 years old and lived in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Nelie runs a mini grocery store at her home to earn a living. She sells canned goods, personal care items, packaged food, cereals, refreshments and school supplies.  She has been this business for 5 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 7,000. Nelie wanted to add to her stocks, so she went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Nelie is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she wants to have a mini-mart that sells both retail and wholesale.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She and her family live in Calamba, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Luzviminda is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living.  She has been doing this work for two years. She plants a good variety of vegetables both for family consumption and for business. She earns PHP 4,000 every month from her vegetable produce.  But the income from her vegetable production is insufficient for their daily consumption, so she must double her production to meet their need.  Luzviminda decided to request a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting season. 

Luzviminda is a new member of GDMPC.  She hopes that someday she will have a hectare of vegetable plantation.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years old.  She is lesbian and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Geraldine own a mini grocery store that sells all kinds of food and refreshments.  She inherited this business from her parents and has been running it for two years.  She earn PHP 6,000 a month in income.   The buildling materials of her store are much too old and need to be replaced.  So, Geraldine went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new building materials to renovate her store. 

Geraldine is a new member of GDMPC.  In the future, she hopes that she can build a larger store that has many stocks to sell.

loans.use: renovate her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, an electrician, and is a mother of two children, one  is in college and the other is working. By the grace of God, Evelyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to enable her son to finish college.  This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Evelyn, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance they can leave to their children.

Evelyn maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer’s order is prepaid in cash by dealers such as Evenyn, and given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference is the profit that the dealers earns as their income.  Evelyn's regular customers are her neighbors and people in her local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1100 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Evelyn is requesting a loan for Php 22,000. She will be utilizing this loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Evelyn dreams of being successful in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week an where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: order more products to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 41 years old.

Lina has a business selling brined shrimp in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shrimp to brine and sell.

Lina has been in this business for 14 years.  In the future, Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to brine and sell

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is an entrepreneur who was born in Kupang 25 years ago. She studied economics at a local university in Kupang. She lives with her lovely mother and six siblings. Two of her sisters are married and one of her brothers is studying at a university in Kupang.  Her father passed away in 1999. 

After the death of her father, Suzana and her mother started a small business selling agricultural products such as mustard greens, “Kangkung”, tomatoes, chilies, cabbages, eggplants, bananas, tofu, and onions.   In addition to selling those items, Suzana also operates coconut rasping machines to earn extra income for her family.

Suzana wants to add more agricultural products to increase her business. She also wants enlarge her business by building a room to lease out. Suzana has applied for her second loan with TLM in the amount of IDR 10,000,000 and expects that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell and build a room to lease

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 40 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She and her family live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Celsa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  She has been cultivating rice for 30 years.  She plants this kind of crop because its  economically in demand.  She earns PHP 50,000 every quarter.  

Celsa is in need of rice seedlings to plant her next crop.  She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to buy rice seedlings to plant her field for the coming season. 

Celsa has been a member of GDMPC more than 3 years. In the future, she hopes that she can buy a 50-hectare field for rice planting.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Nhem, is a 41-year-old man who is the leader of his small group consisting of four male people. He works as a porter in his community, Siem Reap Province. From this job, he can generate a profit averaging $3 each day to cover his family’s needs.  His wife works as a domestic worker in the port and earns around $2 a day for sharing responsibility with him. Mr. Nhem is asking for a Kiva loan in order to buy some planks to repair his house. The couple is blessed with seven children and one is employed as a local porter.

In this group, there are three other borrowers who join all together:

Mr. Ven, a policeman, is asking for a loan to repair his broken house. 
Mr. Meas, a porter, is requesting a loan to purchase nets for his fishing activity. 
Mr. Un, a domestic porter, is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy some planks for repairing his house.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
This is Flordeliz.  She is 38 years old and is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is single and works hard to sustain herself. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Flordeliz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Phps worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Flordeliz earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 712 in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her business, Flordeliz is requesting a loan for Php 10,000 buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flordeliz hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money in the bank. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 67 years old and resides with her child, her grandchild and her husband at Siem Reap province, a place known for tourism.  She is a professional handicrafter, making and selling bamboo baskets at the local market. She has been doing this job since 1993 and is able to make about US $5 of profit each day. 

Her husband stays at home and helps her make and sell baskets. Her child is 26 years old, also making and selling bamboo baskets with an income of US $5 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food and US $20 on other expenses. 

Thy has asked for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase bamboo to make more baskets. In the future, she hopes she will attain a good living standard by selling baskets.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 60 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  He is married and has 2 adult children.  To earn a living,  Antonio operates a specialized retail store which sells assorted products.  He has owned this business for 20 years and earns PHP 20,000 per month.  But Antonio not content with this amount of income per month. He wants to add more stocks to his grocery store to increase his sales. So, he has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 from GDMPC to buy additional stocks to sell to multiply his income each month.

Antonio has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, he wants to expand his current retail store and open a larger grocery store in the city.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Prouem

texts.en: Mrs. Prouem is a polite 37-year-old villager who lives in the Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are employed as local workers in a potato plantation. They typically generate revenues of US$5 each day and have been working in this career for over one year. They also depend on their four children who are employed in the same occupation. The other two children are still learning in public school. As their current house became old and narrow, they weren't able to enlarge their house because they lack the funds. Therefore, Mrs. Prouem would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $500 to be used to a plot of land for structure a new house that is larger than their present house.

loans.use: to a plot of land for structure a new house.

loans.name: Dardanilla

texts.en:
Dardanilla is fifty seven years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is separated from her husband and has 3 children. 

Dardanilla is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for farm maintenance. 

Dardanilla has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes for a better market.  The profit from her business has enabled her to buy goats, cows, pigs, chickens and also to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pay for farm maintenance

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 25 years old.  She is married and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Concepcion has a motorcycle transport rental business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month.  She has requested loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase an additional motorcycle for her business.

Concepcion is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she dreams of purchasing additional motorcycles to rent.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 39 years old and resides with her husband and four children at Siem Reap province, known as a tourist town. She is a housewife and her husband is a driver who has been taking people from Phnom Penh to Siem Reap since 2005. He earns US $15 per day. Three of their children are students. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food, US $10 utilities and US $30 for other expenses. 

Srey has asked for a loan of US $700 to purchase vegetables to sell. She has a truck that can transport the vegetables to the customer as she won't sell retail but by stock. 

In the future, she hopes she will have ability to buy a shop for selling vegetables to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  She is married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, Thu owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Thu has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Thu joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  Thu is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND to purchase materials and auxiliary materials to expand the supply of furniture such as desk chairs. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Thu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thu N. (2) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, Thu Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thu kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Thu đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy.  Thu đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Thu dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  thanh toán tiền học phí của con của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Arooj's Group

texts.en:
Arooj is a 36-year-old lady. She carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to the passengers and to schoolchildren. He is very good at driving. Arooj doesn’t have any children yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw and buy a new rickshaw body, which will allow him to save his business asset and provide better quality transport services to his passengers. Arooj hopes that the loan will help her husband improve his business and increase his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Arooj.

loans.use: To repair and buy a new rickshaw body

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min is a 59-year-old married mother who currently lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She is a local rice farmer. She has always worked on the farm since she was single. Crop planting is the main source of Mrs. Min’s income. She is making about US$3 per day. She is a widow woman who lives with her three children. One child is married and two are single. Two of her kids are a sewing worker and a foreman construction worker. Mrs. Min would like a loan of $700 in order to plant a lotus crop and buy a new boat to start a fishing business.

loans.use: to plant a lotus crop and buy a new boat to start a fishing business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Planting bananas can be pursued as small-scale farming, as a source of food and feeds for the animals, and as additional income for the family. For the past two years, Teresita, a 45-year-old married mother of seven children in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, has been involved in banana production as a source of income. Earning approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

Teresita, a new member of GDMPC, dreams of someday having a banana plantation with the help of God and GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun is 37 years old and resides with husband and children at Ta Keo province. She has been a flower planter at her yard since 2005 and is able to make a profit of about US $1.5 per day. Her husband has been a construction worker at Ta Keo province since 2006 and he earns US $3 per day. She has seven children. Three are students and two are working in the factory. Each of them earns US $4 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $40 on food, US $5 on utility expenses and US $35 on other expenses. 

Eoun has asked for a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike for her child to go to work. In the future, she wants to sell coconut at the market and repair her house to be more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's traveling to work.

loans.name: Loreta Feil

texts.en:
Loreta is very much interested and enjoys mat weaving. Loreta is 32 years old, and she is married with three school-age children. She lived in Bañadero Ozamis city. To earn a living Loreta sells weaved mats. She has been in this business for more than three years. Each month she earn PHP 4,500.00. Loreta has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Loreta requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase additional materials for mat weaving.

In the future, Loreta hopes that she has a progressive business, and can reproduce more product that are demanded by the public.

loans.use: To buy materials for mat weaving.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
In Cambodia, agriculture is the core sector of many fields which is popular for all poor people who live in the countryside.  One of them Mrs. Phorn is a local cultivator and owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. 

She uses this land to grow different kind of crops.  In order to increase their income, her husband is employed as a local doctor in the village.  They have six children, three of whom are single and the remaining three are already married.  There is also additional income, Mrs. Phorn gets from her two kids who are employed in different occupations. 

Mrs. Phorn would like to borrow some fund from HKL partner with Kiva to buy some critical merchandise for selling.  Mrs. Phorn thinks she can have her family have a good standard of living as the other villagers in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province.

loans.use: to purchase some critical merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang is 49 years old and resides with her husband and children at Takeo province. She has sold food and traditional cake for children since 2005. Her income is US $5 per day. Her husband is a farmer and cow feeder at home, earning US $2 per day. She has four children. Three are students and the other one is working in a factory, earning US $2 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $40 on food, US $5 on utilities and US $20 on other expenses. 

Leang has asked for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase tile in order to tile the floor of her house. Her career right now can make good profit so she does not want to change to any other career. She will be working hard to keep her career running smoothly. 

For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy tile to repair her house.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim, 50, and her husband were photographed inside their house.  Both of them have been domestic rice farmers for a long time in Prey Chor district. 

They are able to generate an income of approximately $5 each day to cover their expenses, for instance food expense, education expense and other expenses.  Mrs. Sim will be using her loan to plant different kind of fruits.  The couple has two children who study in school.

loans.use: to plant different kind of fruits.

loans.name: Chanda Nosheen's Group

texts.en:
Chanda nosheen is 44 years of age and has given birth to three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  
She is divorced and lives with her brother. She doesn’t want to become a burden on her brother. She started sewing clothes for her neighboring clients to afford the living expenses for her children and herself. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her brother operates a tea stall in the nearby market. Through his stall, he offers tea of different kinds e.g. green, milky and creamy, to his clients. His tea tastes good. That’s why he has a good number of clients who come to his stall regularly.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy tea, sugar, milk etc. to improve the financial condition of his business. Chanda is confident that an investment in her brother’s business will be a good step towards its growth. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Chanda nosheen.

loans.use: To buy tea, sugar and milk for tea stall business

loans.name: Luân

texts.en:
Luân  is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  She is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Luân  operates a family member's business venture in the arts sector operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Luân  has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luân  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luân  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.944..000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  Luân  is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional furniture products such as beds tables chairs.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Luân  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional furniture products

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture are Mrs. Suos, her husband who live together with their children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province.  Suos, 36, sells various kinds of vegetables in the busy market, and earns approximately $2 profit a day. 

She is married to Mr Roeurn, age 46, who shares responsibility for his family by planting rice crop and some vegetable. Mrs. Suos has five children all of whom are single, and two of them are working in various jobs to earn income.  Since the rainy season is coming, Mrs. Suos would like to request a loan to plant vegetable seeds and to buy fertilizers for her crops to they will grow well.

loans.use: to plant vegetable seeds and to buy fertilizers for her crops to grow well.

loans.name: Vâng

texts.en:
Mrs. Vâng has been spending her life cultivating crops.  This is a skill she had learned from her grandparent when she was young.  She is now married and has eight kids, three are single and five are married.  One is a garment factory worker and another is a construction worker, in the Phnom Penh Capital of Cambodia. 

Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her.  Growing crops is work with which she has had great success.  She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons.  Mrs. Vâng will be using her loan to buy five piglets to raise and with the rest to dig a well to meet the water needs in her whole family.

loans.use: to buy five piglets to raise and with the rest to dig a well to meet the water needs in her whole family.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 49 years old and resides with her husband and her children at Takeo province. 

She has been raising pigs and selling the babies since 1993. Her income is US $3 per day. Her husband is chief of construction workers at Takeo and Phnom Penh, earning US $10 per day. She has three children. Two are working as construction workers and one is a worker in a factory. Each of them earn US $6 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend US $15 on food, US $5 on utilities and US $45 on other expenses. 

Chanthy has asked for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase farmland for farming. With this loan she expects that her career will be better than before and that can lead the family to a better living condition.

loans.use: To buy farmland to do farming.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum, age 47, a domestic rice farmer, has been living in the Prey Chor district. In addition to farming, she sells mortars, which are made of hard stone as the photo shows. She is good at making mortars in a variety of sizes at her house. Sum’s husband also assists her in the same business, and they can earn a net income of US $6.25 a day on average to cover all the family expenses. 

She has two children who work in industry, generating around $4 each day, and they contribute their profit to Sum every month as well.  

Sum will use the loan for buying fertilizers and rice seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, age 32, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. 

She is engaged in a business of selling vegetables and yams, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who sells palm fruits, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Sarim is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase two cows to help plow the rice field. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a caring lady, 57 years of age. She stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She is a very good administrator and manages her household work and expenses very well. Her husband operates a cold drink corner in the market. In his shop, he sells cold drinks such as Coke, Pepsi, Mirinda and artificially flavored juices to his customers. His business becomes demanding in the summer season when people prefer to buy drinks. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy cold drinks and juices in large quantities which will help him to meet his customers' demands on time and to increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past 5 years and Safia is confident that after the loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and increase his profits. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks and juices.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 29, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of weaving traditional silk products, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction foreman, earning an income of $4 per day. 

Phalla is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, age 43, is married and resides with her five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of weaving traditional silk products, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Chenda is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband operates a grocery store in the nearby market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. His rates are very reasonable, that's why he has good number of clients in his area. 

Her husband wants to purchase groceries in bulk for his store; that's why Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan investment will help him in fulfilling the needs of his clients and earn a better income. 

He has been operating his business for the past five years and Shaheen hopes that after the loan investment his business will grow further and his profits will be improved. 

Note: in the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en:
Nhorn, 42 years old, resides with her husband and children at Siem Reap province. She has been a farmer since 2008, earning US $2 per day. Her husband has been a policeman since 2000, earning US $10 per day. She has two children. One is a student and one is a construction worker, earning US $3 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food, US $15 on school fees and US $20 on transportation. 

Nhorn would like to ask for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to go to work and to the field. This loan will help her to reduce the costs of motor taxis and be convenient for her husband's career. 

In the future, she hopes to have a toilet for her house and she wants her children study at university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's work.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 59 years old, widowed and lives in Las Aguadas, Bonifacio Extension, Ozamis City, Misamis occidental, Philippines. Vivian is one of the artist who makes a dress, a dressmaker. She constructs, repairs, and revises any custom dress to earn a living. She has given her service for almost 10 years, with a monthly income of PHP 2,000.00.  Vivian is in need of capital to purchase sewing materials. She requested a loan at GDMPC of PHP 12,000.00 to buy clothing and accessories for her sewing service.

Vivian has been member of GDMPC for one and half years. In the future Vivian hopes and prays that she will be having a tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories for her sewing service.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is 62 years old, single, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Berlinda has spent 15 years in the cosmetics business. She sells beauty products and fashion accessories. She had been doing this type of business for five years with monthly income of PHP 5,000.00. Berlinda wanted to had additional capital for her cosmetic business. As Berlinda heard about the services offer by GDMPC, Berlinda had no doubt to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy cosmetic product for sale.

Berlinda is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Berlinda dreams that even in her age, she can be a great and progressive cosmetics businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics product for sale.

loans.name: Maricel  Group

texts.en:
Maricel is married with one child. She is 27 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamis City. Maricel sells a variety of products for her general store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month she earns Php 3,500 for doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for her general store business.

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchased more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for  her general store business.

loans.name: Gulnaz Begum's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz begum is a 44-year-old married lady. She has completed her education up to the fifth standard but couldn't study further due to the poor financial position of her parents. She is however skilled at sewing, which she learned from her mother. 

She is a mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Her daughter reads in seventh standard. Her elder son is a motor mechanic by profession. Her younger son is involved in the meat-selling business. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides his transport facilities to passengers and school children. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. 

Gulnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy a new body for his rickshaw which will not only secure his business asset but also help him to increase his monthly profits. 

Note: in the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Gulnaz Begum.

loans.use: To buy a new body for a rickshaw

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and widowed with two children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Susana has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Susana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mimosa

texts.en:
Mimosa works hard to support her family. Mimosa is married and has a Carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines. Mimosa has been in this business for six years.

Mimosa requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her local eatery.

In the future, Mimosa would like to save money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her local eatery.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 62, is a widow with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a sari sari (general store) business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 15 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari sari store.

 Teresita would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 53 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Hilaria has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Hilaria requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like cloth and other fabric for her tailoring business.

In the future, Hilaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth and other fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Henry, an auto welder, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosemarie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosemarie earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 280 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosemarie hopes to be able to expand soon and succeed in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Julieta also has been farming fruits and vegetables for five years and earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to establish pasture grounds for her cattle.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to school and to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to establish a pasture.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
