With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar, and to add to his savings toward the purchase of a motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar, and to add to his savings toward the purchase of a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is a single mother caring for four children. She was married years ago, but she divorced her husband. 

Three of her children are making a profit in different jobs while the other attends the local school.
 
She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn hard cash to ensure her children attain the highest level. To earn a living, she sells a few fish-pastes to villagers and the neighbors in the village, Baray district. 

Pov will be using a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her child to run a motor taxi service. This will allow her to gain more income and she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her child to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Yart

texts.en:
Yart, 44 years old, is a farmer. Her income is $1 per day. She is a single mother with one child. He is 23 years old and works in a shoe shop for $3 per day for his income. This is a small family that spends $25 on food, $3 on rent, $35 on transportation and other expenses every month. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her son traveling to work. Besides doing farming, she also does braiding to get more income to save for her son as she plans to have a small shoemaking shop for him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to go to work.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is a hardworking married man who lives in a rented house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a secretarial shop for three years and the business has been profitable. With the income generated he has been able to provide for his family. He has challenges in terms of limited capital. His dream is to buy land and also expand his business. Ronnie is requesting a loan to buy land for resale.

loans.use: to purchase land for resale.

loans.name: Nonvigbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE 1 est formé de quatre personnes qui résident toutes dans la même zone géographique au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Noelie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Noelie est née le 21 Août 1974 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux sont à leur charge. Noelie vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Noelie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Noelie mène comme activité la vente de céréales (maïs, haricot, etc.), ainsi que de la farine de manioc dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Noelie vend de l’huile végétale et de la tomate dans le même quartier. Noelie achète ses produits dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Noelie et son groupe NONVIGBE  1 sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
NONVIGBE 1 is a group composed of four persons who all reside in the same geographical area of Benin. Noelie is this group’s representative. She is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She was born on August 21, 1974 in a city in Benin. She is married to man named Julien. The couple has four children, who are all in school. Two of the children are their dependents. Noelie lives together with her family. The couple jointly ensures that the various family expenses are covered. 

For nearly four years, Noelie has been running a business selling grains (corn, beans, etc.), as well as cassava flour, in her district. Concurrent to this business, she sells vegetable oil and tomatoes in the same district. She purchases these goods in one of the markets of Benin. This is the third time that Noelie and her group NONVIGBE 1 have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to bolster their businesses in order to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cassava flour, vegetable oil, and tomatoes

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 48 years old, does braiding with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have three children, and they are 22, 21, and 19 years old. All of them are working in the factory and get $5 for each day.  

Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on rent and $50 on transportation and other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to get to work. 

In the future, she wants to have a good house, because now her house is not in good condition and needs a lot of repair.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children get to work.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and lives in Pob. 2, larin, Mis. Occ.  She is married with 3 children.

Jane has a shop that sells a variety of products.  She has had this business for 8 years.  She requested a loan to
purchased more products for her retail store business.

Jane has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchased more products for her retail store business

loans.name: Derince

texts.en:
Derince is a 35 year old lady and married to Yakobus, a 39 year old farmer.  From their marriage they have been blessed with three sons.  They are: Harun, 9 years old and Marco, 8 years old who are in Elementary School and the youngest one is Julio, 7 years old who will enter elementary school this year.

Derince owns a kiosk business which sells primary commodities such as sugar, cooking oil, candies, shampoo, cigarettes etc, while her husband works as a farmer, cultivating plants such as cassava and corn to be consumed by their family.  Derince runs her business to help her husband in generating money for her family. 

Sometimes Derince faces difficulty in meeting their daily needs as well as the education needs of Harun and Marco because the income generated from the kiosk business sometimes is insufficient.  Derince intends to have a more complete inventory of products at her kiosk by purchasing more stocks such as: detergent, rice, kipper, wheat flour, and etc as demanded by her costumer. 

Derince is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3, 000,000 from TLM.  She really hopes that TLM will assist her by providing the loan so she would be able to improve her business and better meet her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks such as: detergent, rice, kipper, wheat flour, etc

loans.name: Genard

texts.en:
Genard has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 50 years old, married to Rose and they have 3 children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his 1st loan.  He plans to plant potatoes in his farm.  He will use the loan amount to buy fertilizer which he will use during the planting season.

In future, Genard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lout

texts.en:
Lout is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Lout is married to Phorn, age 37. The couple work together in the farming business, and they have given birth to two children. One of their children is employed in manufacturing and the remaining one is learning in the local school. 

Lout would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting. For the future, she hopes to buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motorbike taxi service.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Adja

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 30 ans et mère de trois enfants, Adja est revendeuse de maïs  et charbon de bois devant son domicile depuis 2008 et pour les besoins de son commerce elle s’approvisionne à Anié. Son mari est chauffeur et pour l’aider dans le ménage, elle se bat au quotidien pour supporter les dépenses  du foyer. Elle aimerait augmenter son stock  et pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit auprès de notre institution.
texts.en: A young woman, 30 years of age, and the mother of three, Adja  has been selling corn and charcoal in front of her house since 2008. She stocks up on her goods in Anié. Her husband is a driver. To help him support the family, she works very hard daily to cover the household needs. She would like to increase this stock and for this reason she is seeking a loan from our institution.

loans.use: to buy corn and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing materials, threads and other materials for an expanded business and better services.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf, a 32 year old man is living with his wife Anin, who is 25 years old and they have two children: Yuventa who is 6 years old and in kindergarten and Regads who is 4 years old.  Yusuf owns a rice business that he runs to support his family.  He has been engaged in this business for two and a half years.  Yusuf usually purchases the stock in the rice milling nearby his residence even though sometimes he should go to Bena village, which is situated about 20 km from his village to buy good quality rice. 

In a day Yusuf is able to generate income between IDR 50,000, - to 75,000.  Yusuf is a hard worker.  In addition to selling rice Yusuf also has a plot of land to farm.  He usually cultivates vegetables on the farm to be sold after harvest.  

Yusuf dreams to improve his business. He thinks that rice is a staple food particularly in the urban area so he is sure that it will be sold out quicker.
Yusuf is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to purchase a large quantity of rice to be sold.  Yusuf has a desire to save part of his money for the educational needs of his children in the future.  He is hoping that TLM is willing to assist him in providing a business loan for the improvement of his business as well as his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of rice

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 46-year-old married man with eight children living in his own permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He takes care of his family with the help of his wife who is a farmer. Their dream is to set up a farm and educate their children.
Patrick has been in the retail business for a year after saving up from the sale of bananas. He has the challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. His dream is to become a wholesaler. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Ama est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Depuis 1990 elle s’est lancée dans la préparation de boisson locale faite à base de mil et très appréciée  par la population. Elle se boit frais ou à température ambiante. Elle s’approvisionne de mil au Grand Marché d’AGOE et revend après transformation à domicile. Ce troisième prêt lui servira à acheter du mil afin d’assurer  un avenir radieux à ses enfants et aider son mari. Elle vend aussi des ignames.
texts.en:
Ama is 46 years old, married, and a mother of three. In 1990, she launched her business preparing a local beverage made from millet, which is much appreciated by people. It is served chilled or at room temperature.
She gets her millet supplies at Agoe's Grand Market and resells after processing it at home. This third loan will allow her to buy millet to ensure a bright future for her children and to help her husband. She also sells yams.

loans.use: to buy millet to prepare drinks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 54-year-old entrepreneur is married to Fransina, a 43-year-old lady. Moses has 4 children. They are:
1)\tMarlen, 22 years old, who works as a shopkeeper, 
2)\tConstantino, 20 years old, who works as a motorbike taxi driver 
3)\tMolano, 14 years old, who attends the second grade of junior high school, and 
4)\tRichard, 4 years old. 

Moses runs a rice milling business. He has been running the business since 2005. He initiated the business by using his own capital. His business runs quite well but several competitors have arisen near his village. Moses plans to enlarge his business by selling rice as an additional business.  

Unfortunately, his milling machine has broken so he cannot run his business well. He has to replace a spare part on the machine as soon as possible, as his family depends on the business. However, the spare part is quite expensive to buy. So Moses is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on the spare part and paddy (unprocessed rice) to be milled.  He will then sell the milled rice on the market.

He is expecting that TLM will help him by approving his loan application so he will be able to run his business as usual.

loans.use: To purchase a spare part and paddy to be milled

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 39-year-old married man who has four children that attend school.  He bakes and sells cakes to earn a living.  He has 10 years of experience in running the business.  He also farms to supplement his income.
  
Since Moses joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour for baking cakes.  

Moses hopes to own a big bakery and find other markets for selling cakes in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of high-grade manure for his farm

loans.name: Yaovi Sourou

texts.fr: Mr Yaovi est âgé de 34ans. Il a 02 enfants et sa femme est couturière. Tailleur de profession, il a constaté que dans son quartier  ils ont du mal à moudre les céréales (mais, haricot, riz, mil) c’est pour cela il sollicite ce premier prêt pour résoudre ce problème.
texts.en: Mr. Yaovi is 34 years old. He has two children, and his wife is a seamstress. A tailor by trade, he has noticed that people in his neighborhood have a hard time grinding cereals (corn, beans, rice, millet). This is why he is requesting this first loan in order to solve this problem.

loans.use: to buy a grinder.

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Takuru” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Issa. Issa was born in a town call Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 32 years of age. Issa is married and has 3 children – 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Issa has been a businessman for 21 years. He sells used clothes. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business. 

The inset photo is a snapshot of Santigie, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes
